title: Senior Manager, Talent Business Partner
description:
***This hybrid position will be based in our Boston office Monday\- Thursday, with Fridays remote.***



At Wayfair, we love to solve complex business problems with technology to serve our millions of customers, to sell and deliver a catalog of millions of products, and to continue growing at a rapid pace. Wayfair is on a path to be the world’s largest online destination for the home, tapping into a TAM of $1200bln by 2030\. Our marketplace offers over 30 million products from 23,000 suppliers and we served 24 million customers in 2021 alone.



We are looking for a Senior Talent Business Partner (Senior Manager, HRBP) to support the Global Service and Primary Sales organization. Our Talent Business Partner team is the strategic arm of Talent focused on identifying, developing and implementing projects and initiatives to staff, on\-board, develop, motivate, assess, retain and organize our talent who ultimately enable our high growth business. We push our senior leaders to think strategically about their people and are accountable for building the organizational structures, leadership and future teams that will propel Wayfair's success as a business. We weave together talent\-related data to tell a cohesive story about the organizations we support and where we need to invest and arm our stakeholders with the data they need to make strategic decisions.


**Who You Are**


* Proactive and uses good judgment when defining / executing plans against nuanced and highly confidential and complex situations \- pivoting as needed along the way
* Strong business acumen and customer focus with a sense of urgency and precise execution capabilities
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and a passion for working across multiple leaders and their teams, synthesizing points of view and owning a coherent action plan
* Strongly hypothesis driven, comfortable diving\-deep and analyzing data with the ability to interpret, translate, and communicate findings in ways that motivate and empower leaders to take action
* Proven experience in executive coaching, influencing leaders in an ambiguous, fast\-paced, matrixed environment
* A consistent bar raiser \- you’re self\-aware, curious, and passionate about the business context and continuously iterating and improving to drive impact


**What You’ll Do**


* Partner with key Talent teams and business leaders to design and deliver execution strategies supporting broad change initiatives *(e.g. optimizing organizational design, changing operating models, welcoming new leaders, etc.)*
* Coach functional partners \- across levels \- on managing performance feedback, leadership development, and conflict management with their teams
* Partner with central Talent partners, Talent Business Partners, and key stakeholders to develop and implement scalable calibration, compensation and development processes
* Provide guidance and advising on best practices to support managers on effectively managing, evaluating, and growing individual performance and development
* Advise and consult in the resolution of employee relations concerns by partnering with employees and managers to recommend effective, equitable, and scalable solutions
* Conduct investigations, provide accurate and timely responses to concerns, and determine solutions that mitigate risk and uphold legal compliance and equity
* Partner to support people\-focused, department\-specific business objectives by leading core analyses (e.g. employee voice surveys, deep\-dives, listening sessions etc.) and use related outputs to shape action planning that yields a positive impact on efficiency, customer, and revenue/cost
* Amplify central Talent initiatives \- gathering stakeholder feedback, cascading key messages, and capturing and sharing back insights around outcomes


**What You’ll Need**


* 7\+ years of experience in Human Resources as a Human Resources Business Partner (HRBP) or a direct business\-facing support role
* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business, Communications, or related field
* Extensive experience in labor and employee relations, including conducting investigations, resolving complex workplace issues, and ensuring compliance with employment laws and company policies
* Experience supporting, coaching, and partnering with Director/VP level business stakeholders
* Experience leading and developing a direct team
* Preferred experience supporting front\-line populations up to 500\+ employees
* Ability to travel on average of 10% of the time
* Advanced skills/experience with HRIS, Google Office Suite


**Benefits \& Perks**


* Full health benefits available (Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA) on day one for eligible employees.
* No\-cost access to 2nd.MD, a virtual expert medical consultation and navigation service.
* Global Traveler Health Insurance through GeoBlue.
* 24/7 access to mental, financial, physical and emotional wellbeing support, plus an enhanced offering of therapy and coaching..
* Automatic enrollment into Basic Life and Accidental Death \& Disability Insurance.
* 401(k) matching with immediate vesting.
* Paid Parental Leave, Surrogacy \& Adoption Reimbursement and Caregiver Services.
* Tuition Reimbursement.
* Wayfair Employee Discount.
* Gym/Fitness Discounts (including Peloton, Wellhub and varying regional memberships).
* Exclusive access to thousands of perks \& discounts through BenefitHub.
* Yearly match up to $500 for personal donations made by employees to registered 501(c)(3\) nonprofits.


**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

title: Recruiting Coordinator
description:
Wayfair is seeking a Recruiting Coordinator to be the operational and community\-driving force behind our hiring efforts in Athens. In this Coordinator hybrid role (80% coordination / 20% recruiting), you’ll ensure every candidate and stakeholder experience is seamless, professional, and efficient. You’ll serve as a boots\-on\-the\-ground brand ambassador—connecting with the local community, supporting events, and driving applicant momentum.



We’re looking for someone who proactively builds relationships, is highly organized, tech\-forward, detail\-oriented, and thrives in a fast\-paced, constantly evolving environment. If you’re someone who welcomes feedback, loves improving processes, and knows your way around Google Suite like a pro, this is the role for you.


**This is a 5 day in office onsite role.**


### **What You’ll Do:**


* Coordinate all cross\-functional partnerships, recruiting processes, including:
* + Offer letter generation, requisition submission, background check initiation, and audit documentation
	+ Maintaining data accuracy in all recruiting systems and trackers
	+ Running reports and ensuring alignment with hiring goals and process integrity.
* Own candidate logistics for hybrid interviews: scheduling, coordinating, and welcoming candidates onsite.
* Lead Day 1 onboarding touchpoints: conduct new hire meet and greets and serve as the Talent Acquisition point\-of\-contact.
* Partner with Recruiters to support sourcing, resume review, and proactive referral outreach as needed.
* Conduct interviews as needed to support high\-volume hiring periods.
* Lead localized talent outreach efforts:
* Actively engage with the Athens and surrounding communities to drive interest in Wayfair’s hiring opportunities
* Distribute marketing materials such as flyers and signage in targeted locations to increase brand visibility
* Represent Wayfair at local job fairs, hiring events, and community programs to promote employment opportunities.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with local organizations, schools, and community partners to support pipeline development and strengthen our employer brand

### **What You’ll Need:**


* 1–2 years of experience in recruiting coordination, HR support, operations, or an administrative role in a fast\-paced environment
* Strong organizational skills with an acute attention to detail and accuracy
* High proficiency with Google Suite (Docs, Sheets, Slides, Forms) and the ability to learn and navigate multiple platforms
* Ability to be onsite 5 days a week, with flexibility to attend recruiting events at night or on weekends as needed (with comp days offered accordingly)
* A proactive, curious mindset—always looking for ways to improve processes and enhance experience
* Ability to confidently communicate and collaborate with individuals at all levels of the organization
* Independently accountable / fully owns initiatives without a manager onsite.
* Receptive to feedback and able to implement changes with agility
* Comfortable managing multiple priorities and shifting tasks in a dynamic environment
* Professional presence and confidence in both virtual and in\-person settings

 **About Wayfair Inc.**

title: Operations Manager
description:
**Operations Manager**



We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!



What You’ll Do


* The Warehouse Manager will collaborate with our Supervisor team to solve immediate day\-to\-day operational issues.
* Develop robust, trusting relationships with key stakeholders and senior leadership, and identify opportunities to improve the Warehousing productivity. You’ll command a strong senior presence, and build a team of high performing Supervisors.
* Monitor and drive key service level metrics for fulfillment to ensure that we are providing excellent customer experience and delivering on our promise.
* Support operational strategy and innovation to drive business goals for revenue, operational performance, and profitability.
* Manage, coach, develop team of Operations Supervisors.
* Manage multiple priorities in a face\-paced environment with effective communication and thorough follow through.
* Establish sound process improvement initiatives that drive year over year improvement, as well as streamline and optimize day\-to\-day operations.


What You’ll Need


* Bachelor Degree or equivalent work and/or military experience.
* 5\+ years of operations management experience.
* Strong administrative, organizational, managerial and communication skills.
* Analytical ability necessary to gather and interpret data, and develop, recommend, implement solutions
* Able to work collaboratively across functions and synthesize multiple points of view into a streamlined action plan. Able to effectively drive results in a fast\-paced and rapidly growing company.
* Senior presence with thoughtful, articulate communication style. Adept at communicating up and down and at pivoting approach depending on the audience’s needs.
* Familiarity with Excel and SQL are a plus.

  


**Salary:** The salary range for this position is $87,500\-$96,500 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per the California Salary Transparency Law

title: Full Time Inbound Sale Agent - Athens, GA
description:
**Quick Insights:**
* Full\-Time Position
* Compensation: $15\.00/hour \+ Uncapped Monthly Bonus  

*(Average earnings with bonus \& hourly wage combined is estimated at \~$23 per hour)*
* This is an in\-office position and will require you to physically report to our Athens, GA office daily.
* You must have prior sales experience of 1\+ year to be considered for this position.

  

**Schedule**: Your schedule will be an 8 hour shift, 5 days per week including one weekday and one weekend day off. Schedules will be between the following hours: Saturday \& Sunday 8a \-8p, Monday \- Friday 8a \- 8p and will be selected during your interview.  



Overview:  

We are seeking individuals with prior sales experience who are driven by sales goals with a passion to assist shoppers in their purchasing experience to join our team. As a Sales Generalist Agent, you'll leverage your expertise to help drive Wayfair sales performance and results through meaningful customer interactions. Your ability to understand and communicate will be key in helping our customers make informed purchasing decisions and achieving your sales goals. If you love to connect with customers to help them find and purchase amazing products, then Wayfair may be the place for you!


**What Does a Sales Generalist Agent Do?**


* **Handle a High Volume of Contacts:** This is an in\-office, inbound sales role where you will handle inbound sales calls, (approximately \~40\-50 a day). This is a fast paced environment and highly structured where you will quickly build rapport, assist customers with questions, finding items, and purchasing those items.
* **Demonstrate Reliability:** Attendance and commitment to being present and on time for your full shift each day is crucial. This helps ensure we're ready and available to help our customers when they need us most. For unexpected events or issues, we require our representatives to be proactive in their communication and planning whenever possible.
* **Practice Patience and Communicate Effectively**: Exercise patience, active listening, and provide clear, concise information. Effective communication is essential in addressing customer questions and creating memorable experiences that build trust and satisfaction.
* **Engage with Suppliers for Complete Customer Solutions**: When necessary, reach out to product suppliers to obtain details or information not readily available on our website. This extra step ensures we meet customer needs comprehensively and with confidence.
* **Adhere to Structured Sales Process:** Follow our established call flow, including asking probing questions, confidently assuming the sale, and building rapport. These steps are key to consistently delivering a high\-quality, customer\-centered experience.
* **Think Critically and Maximize the Customer Experience**: Analyze each customer’s unique needs, and proactively offer complementary items through upselling or cross\-selling to elevate their overall purchase experience.


* **Drives Performance through Metrics:** We measure success based on key operational metrics. Your compensation will be closely aligned with these performance standards, which helps to ensure our goals and your success are interconnected.
* **Stay Focused and Professional:** Maintain a distraction\-free workspace, enabling you to dedicate your full attention to customers throughout your virtual shift. Being fully present is essential for providing the best possible service.
* **Proficiency with Technology and Adaptability:** This role requires familiarity with technology, comfort with multitasking, and flexibility. Stay updated with policy and process changes via email or chat, and be prepared to handle unexpected challenges like connectivity issues or unique inquiries.
* **Active Team Participation:** Engage in team activities, such as sales contests, training sessions, and other culture\-building events. Your active participation is vital to fostering a collaborative and motivated team environment.
* **Adaptability for Peak Seasons:** During peak seasons, be prepared for potential schedule adjustments and mandatory overtime to support our customers and meet seasonal demands.


**What are the Requirements?**


* You must be 18 years of age or older
* **Sales Experience:** 1\+ year of previous sales experience with demonstrated success in meeting or exceeding KPI’s or performance metrics. (call center, retail, or virtual environments preferred)
* **Mandatory Training:** Wayfair wants to ensure your success, this is why our sales training is 100% mandatory. We are unable to accommodate any absences, time off, or tardiness during this initial time frame.
* **Technical Proficiency:** Ability to effectively navigate multiple software systems and tools while also having a level of comfort with learning new tools or systems. Google, Microsoft office, email platforms, video conferencing, team collaboration software, navigating multiple screens, spreadsheets, etc. are highly beneficial experiences.
* **Education:** High school diploma or equivalent is required. Some college preferred
* **Adaptability:** You must have a willingness to adapt and grow in a fast paced, high growth industry.
* **Multitasking Ability:** Capable of handling multiple conversations or customers simultaneously while maintaining an excellent customer experience.
* Note: Qualified applicants will be required to pass the candidate assessment to proceed with the interview process.


**Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities**  

Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. As part of this commitment, Wayfair will make reasonable accommodations to the known physical or mental limitations of qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on business operations. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, please let us know by completing our Accomodations for Applicants form.

title: Warehouse Team Lead
description:
**Shift**

* Wed\-Sat 6am\-4:30pm

 **Base Pay Rate*** **$23\.75/hour**
**What You'll Do**

* The Warehouse Team Lead will assist your supervisor with managing and overseeing all functions of the warehouse, and ensuring smooth operations of all activities
* Lead the receiving department and ensure the functions are used correctly
* Delegate and assign work to keep a 100% fill rate
* Help manage the inventory and conduct necessary training within the department
* Ensure the proper use and accountability of tools
* Ensure hours and functions are recorded correctly (e.g. Time clocks)
* Be responsible for answering email and verbal questions in a timely manner
* Keep product moving and oversee the cleanliness of the department. This includes daily trash compacting
* Additional responsibilities as assigned

**What You’ll Need**

* Working understanding of WMS system.
* Leadership and motivational skills, and the ability to make decisions with little to no guidance based on policies or common sense
* This is a floor position, and will involve physically moving/processing products in addition to leading a team of warehouse associates
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 pounds unassisted and maneuvering product 150\+ pounds unassisted or via team lift
* Experienced in more than one department. Work areas include: receiving, inventory control, pick, pack, ship and return of product
* Experience with composing and replying to emails
* Power Equipment experience – Must be able to operate or willing to be trained on Powered Industrial Truck Operations (PITO)
* Experience with creating and updating systems such as trouble tickets
* 2\+ years working experience. Must have excellent attendance
* Understanding of High Jump is a plus

title: Full-Time Design Specialist
description:
Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring for our Joss \& Main retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, this store might be the future home for your career.

  


**What you’ll do:**


* Provide an authentic, friendly customer experience that exemplifies our Wayfair commitment to relentless customer focus.
* Leverage interior design and sales expertise in the home furnishings space to help our customers navigate through their design needs and purchases (such as fabric, finishes, texture of the product).
* Provide coaching and support to Design Sales Advisors and support their allocated workload efforts as determined by the Store Leader. Depending on the specific work shift, this associate will help open and/or close the store, with keyholder responsibilities.
* Support Store Leaders to train and develop and support the Design team on knowledge of our product, selling, customer service, operations, visual, and other aspects of their roles.
* Manage virtual, in\-store and in\-home design appointments (including preparation of design deliverables, product curation, and follow up)
* Utilize sales analytics and design software tools and applications to drive store profitability and growth in a way that supports the success of the overall brand (moodboards, space plans, 2d/3d room views)
* Meet or exceed sales and customer satisfaction targets, and other established KPIs
* Participate in operational store activities as needed: bringing new products to the floor, floor sets, replenishment and substitutions
* Engage in a high energy, focused and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions, offerings and operations
* Bring a willingness to share innovative ideas and solutions to continuously improve team operations

  


**What you’ll need:**


* Willingness to travel for in\-home consultations. If driving your personal vehicle, proof of the state required auto liability insurance or proof of financial responsibility \& a state issued driver’s license may be required.
* 3\+ years of sales experience (Interior design , furniture, or home goods experience preferred.)
* Experience motivating a team to achieve sales goals (preferably as a leader or trainer in a store environment)
* Understanding of design principles including spatial planning, fabric selection, interior design styles and trends
* Demonstrated ability to work within a team sales environment, strong desire to see the teams around you succeed and exceed sales targets.
* Strong organization, self\-motivation, communication and relationship management skills
* Track record of thriving in a fast paced and changing environment
* Technical acumen to learn necessary software; proficiency in Google Suites and/or Microsoft Office applications preferred.
* Ability to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends, and holidays
* Bachelor’s degree or college diploma equivalent preferred

#### **Physical Requirements:**


* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.


**Compensation \& Benefits:**


* Compensation starting at $21\.40 per hour, which increases based on your relevant experience \+ substantial quarterly bonuses
* Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount

title: Warehouse Labor Planning Operations Manager - Jacksonville, FL
description:
**Warehouse Industrial Engineer \- Workflow Controller**



The Warehouse IE\-Workflow Controller plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site specific goals across Wayfair's Fulfillment Network. They work to ensure the accurate, timely, and cost efficient processing of the perfect order to our customers.


**What You'll Do**


* You will create daily operating plans for a site and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for building plans at this cadence to align with Site Director and network priorities
* You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
* You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to mid\-long term volume projections
* Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
* Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
* You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
* You’ll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan \- i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
* You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
* You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
* Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements


**What You'll Need**


* 3\+ years operational experience in distribution or manufacturing
* Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively
* Capacity Planning experience or Industrial Engineering background focused on operations flow and labor management
* Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ
* Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
* Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
* Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements
* You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future
* Not a remote/virtual position

title: Global Payroll Manager
description:
***This hybrid position will be based in our Boston office Monday\- Thursday, with Fridays remote.***



We are seeking an experienced Global Payroll Manager to lead strategic payroll initiatives and drive the standardization of payroll processes. This role is responsible for managing a team of payroll professionals as well as outsourced payroll providers, ensuring compliance with local and international payroll laws, and improving operational efficiency through process optimization.



The ideal candidate is a hands\-on leader with deep knowledge of multi\-state and international payroll, strong analytical capabilities, and the ability to build scalable and compliant payroll processes across regions


**What You’ll Do**


* Manage and develop a team of payroll professionals, including hiring, training, coaching, and performance evaluation.
* Oversee global payroll functions, including multi\-state and international payroll processing, ensuring accuracy and compliance.
* Guide, oversee and direct payroll policy and procedures.
* Streamline treasury funding requests for international payrolls.
* Lead process improvement initiatives across regions to standardize payroll operations and optimize efficiency.
* Ensure regional payroll compliance with federal, state, and local wage and hour laws, as well as international payroll regulations and best practices.
* Administer and manage relationships with third\-party payroll vendors and systems ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and cost\-effectiveness.
* Collaborate with Talent, Finance, Legal, and Corporate Tax departments to ensure alignment on compensation, benefits, and regulatory requirements.
* Oversee payroll tax reporting and year\-end activities, including W\-2s and other regulatory filings.
* Analyze payroll data, identify trends, and develop KPIs and reporting tools to provide insights and recommendations to senior leadership.
* Continuously evaluate payroll processes and internal controls, identifying opportunities for automation and improvement.


**What You’ll Need**


* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, HR, or related field.
* 5\+ total Payroll experience, preferred Global Payroll Management experience with 10K plus employees.
* Extensive knowledge of U.S. and international payroll compliance, tax regulations, and wage laws.
* Proven experience with multi\-state and/or global payroll management in a leadership capacity.
* Proficient with payroll systems such as Workday, or similar platforms.
* Proven experience managing outsourced payroll providers across the global landscape.
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel (e.g., pivot tables, formulas, and data analysis).
* Strong organizational, problem\-solving, and communication skills.
* Ability to manage cross\-functional teams and multiple priorities in a fast\-paced environment.
* Certified Payroll Professional (CPP) designation preferred.


**Physical Demands \& Work Environment**


* Must be mobile and able to perform the physical requirements of the job, bending, kneeling, stooping, pushing, pulling and repetitive motion.
* Ability to sit and work at a computer for long periods of time.
* Able to move intermittently throughout the workday.


**Benefits \& Perks**


* Full health benefits available (Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA) on day one for eligible employees.
* No\-cost access to 2nd.MD, a virtual expert medical consultation and navigation service.
* Global Traveler Health Insurance through GeoBlue.
* 24/7 access to mental, financial, physical and emotional wellbeing support, plus an enhanced offering of therapy and coaching..
* Automatic enrollment into Basic Life and Accidental Death \& Disability Insurance.
* 401(k) matching with immediate vesting.
* Paid Parental Leave, Surrogacy \& Adoption Reimbursement and Caregiver Services.
* Tuition Reimbursement.
* Wayfair Employee Discount.
* Gym/Fitness Discounts (including Peloton, Wellhub and varying regional memberships).
* Exclusive access to thousands of perks \& discounts through BenefitHub.
* Yearly match up to $500 for personal donations made by employees to registered 501(c)(3\) nonprofits.

Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. title: Flex Warehouse Associate
description:
***The pay for this position is $19\.00/hr***



We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!

 **Shifts:**


* 4 hour shifts available
* Work up to 28 hours per week


**Wayfair Benefits**


* **$2\.00****/hr Shift Differential for hours worked between 6:00pm \- 6:00am**
* Weekly Pay (Fridays)
* Referral bonus
* Wayfair company discount
* Dozens of discounts and perks with partners!


**What You'll Do**


* Unload and receive inbound furniture orders which will require manually moving large, heavy goods.
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 pounds unassisted and maneuvering product 150\+ pounds unassisted or via team lift.
* Use scan technology to document pertinent carton level information, including condition, quantity, and warehouse location of material.
* Proactively monitor order management systems to ensure that all orders have been received properly and that detailed descriptions are provided for any Overage/Shortage/Damage issues.
* Perform regular cycle counts to ensure inventory is accurate and up to date.
* Pick deliveries from inventory and stage them by truck and stop number.
* Provide direct input into the existing user tools and make recommendations for improvements based on your everyday experience.
* Be a vocal contributor on the team.
* Work effectively with peers and managers.
* Identify the most efficient way to complete assigned tasks and ask clarifying questions when appropriate.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.
* Be cross trained in other departments and required to perform additional responsibilities as assigned


**What You'll Need**


* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 lbs. unassisted and moving product 150\+ lbs. unassisted or via team lift.
* Must be able to work on warehouse floor 8 hours a day or more.
* Strong, consistent work ethic.
* Comfort with scanning technology.
* Experience in Distribution or Logistics is a plus.
* Experience working in High Jump is a plus.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.

title: Sr. Specialist Business Development, B2B Retail & Design
description:
**Sr. Specialist Business Development, B2B Retail \& Design**  

  

*The hourly compensation for this role is $24/hr.*  

  

**Overview:**  

  

At Wayfair, we’re transforming the way businesses shop for their spaces—and as an in\-store **B2B Sales Specialist**, you’ll be on the front lines of that mission. This isn’t your typical sales role. You’ll act as a trusted partner to local businesses, helping them discover the power of Wayfair Professional and our in\-store design expertise. Whether it’s a boutique hotel redesign, a new office buildout, or ongoing projects for local contractors, such as Interior Designers, you’ll be their go\-to guide for all things Wayfair.



This role blends sales development, community building, and hands\-on customer support. You’ll grow our professional customer base by connecting with new prospects, activating and growing business from existing accounts, and working closely with in\-store teams to bring large\-scale projects to life. At Wayfair, we believe in hustle *and* heart—and in this role, you’ll find both.



Ready to drive impact, grow your pipeline, and help businesses bring their visions to life? Let’s make it happen.

  

**What Does a B2B Sales Specialist Do?**


* **Grow the B2B Business:** Build relationships with local Wayfair Professional customers—both new and existing—by prospecting, cold calling, and community engagement. Your goal? Drive awareness, increase in\-store program adoption, and help businesses unlock the full potential of the Wayfair Professional Program.
* **Engage Local Wayfair Professional Customers:** Proactively reach out to existing and potential B2B customers in the local market to promote the value of our in\-store experience, encourage visits, and connect them with our Design Specialists. Reengage inactive accounts and uncover new opportunities through tailored outreach and relationship\-building strategies.
* **Prospect Net\-New Customers:** Use online research, walk\-ins, and cold outreach to connect with business owners across industries. You’ll validate enrollment status, pitch program benefits, and help them get started with Wayfair Professional.
* **Build Local Partnerships:** Develop relationships with area business associations, real estate developers, and design industry organizations. Share insights and collaborate with the home office to scale successful partnership models across markets.
* **Coordinate Events:** Partner with store leadership and marketing to host monthly in\-store B2B events and identify opportunities for community engagement that showcase Wayfair’s offerings and expertise.
* ️ **Support B2B Projects In\-Store:** Act as the go\-to B2B expert for store teams and customers alike. You’ll answer program questions, connect customers to the right design and delivery services, and support complex or large\-scale orders.
* **Enable the Team:** Educate associates on B2B tools, benefits, and workflows. Collaborate closely with our instore and virtual Sales teams to ensure a seamless handoff for customers visiting our store from remote channels.

  


**You’ll Thrive in this Role if You Have:**


* **Sales Drive:** 2\-3 years of general sales experience with a proven track record of hitting or exceeding goals—preference in B2B development or trade environments.
* ️ **Retail Know\-How:** 1–2 years of retail experience working with customers, ideally in high\-touch or specialty sales settings.
* **Great Communication:** You’re comfortable building rapport over the phone, in person, or via email. You know how to listen, engage, and follow up like a pro.
* ️ **Organizational Excellence:** You can juggle multiple priorities without dropping the ball—whether it's planning outreach, logging customer notes in Salesforce, or coordinating an event.
* **Strategic Thinking:** You’re proactive in identifying opportunities, digging into data, and thinking three steps ahead to unlock growth.
* **Tech Comfort:** You’re familiar with CRMs (Salesforce), POS systems, and productivity tools like Google Suite.
* **Team Collaboration:** You thrive in a fast\-paced, cross\-functional environment and love partnering with others to drive results.
* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree required.
* **Flexible Availability:** Able to work full\-time, including peak business hours, to support the needs of B2B customers in\-store.
* **Ability to Travel:** You will be required to travel locally as needed to meet with customers, businesses, or partners. Typically this will fall within a 50\-mile radius.

  


**Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:**


* **Physical Activity:**Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
* **Mobility \& Movement:** Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
* **Lifting Ability:** Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs regularly.
* **Vision Requirements:** Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
* ️ **Temperature Flexibility:** Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
* **Noise Tolerance:** Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
* + ️ **Safety Awareness:** Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazards—must adhere to all safety protocols.

  

**What are the Benefits\*?**


* **Competitive Pay:** Earn competitive compensation, with regular opportunities for performance\-based increases and performance based bonuses.
* **Career Growth:** Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
* **Health Benefits from Day One:** Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
* **Time to Recharge:** Start accruing paid time off immediately—because work\-life balance matters.
* **401(k) with Company Match:** We’ll match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
* **Tuition Reimbursement:** Eligible after 6 months of employment—learn, grow, and get support along the way.
* **Wayfair Employee Discount:** Save big on the pieces you love—plus get 10% off at our in\-store restaurant ️.
* **Parental Leave Options:** Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.
* ✨ **And So Much More:** We’ve got more good stuff where that came from! NOTE: our full\-time roles receive the full benefits package above, while part\-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in\-store team can help with any questions!

 **About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.

title: Wayfair Outlet Assistant Store Manager
description:
**Wayfair Outlet Assistant Store Manager**


**The position is based in Burlington, ON**



Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring an Assistant Store Manager for our returns Outlet retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, Wayfair’s Outlet store might be the future home for your career.


**What you’ll do:**


* As an authentic brand ambassador for the Wayfair family, lead and create a best in class customer experience by connecting them with the world's biggest and best home online assortment brought to life in our stores.
* Assist the Store Manager in bringing the Wayfair brand family to life by building a high performing customer centric team, and actively linking them in an authentic way to all channels.
* Lead and develop a team of Sales Associates to meet sales goals
* Master our brand story and be able to share our brand with polished communication, personal appearance and professionalism.
* Consistently recruit, hire, and retain a salesforce that delights and inspires our customers while driving sales.
* Build a talent pipeline, both internal and external, to deliver budgeted sales and best in class customer experience
* Build schedules that allow for best in class customer service, meet all operational business requirements and are fair and balanced for associates.
* Maintain leadership presence through effective floor management and resource allocation.
* Identify customers’ needs, and balance with operational requirements to meet customer experience standards.
* Perform opening and closing routines and provide supervision to ensure the store is meeting financial goals and associates are providing best in class service to our customers.
* Foster and instill a culture of accountability and continuous feedback to promote a profitable, positive, and dynamic environment.
* Assist the Store Manager in leading a team to always use good judgment; demonstrate a culture of ethical conduct, security, and compliance.
* Ensure the team feels supported and inspired daily; Treat all personnel internally and externally with respect, empathy, and inclusion.
* Manage stockroom organization and supply levels to maximize efficiency, safety and productivity to support sales floor replenishment.
* Utilize sales analytics tools to drive store profitability and growth in a way that supports the success of the overall brand.
* Manage and monitor stock levels, merchandise adjacencies, presentations, signing, and assortment in all departments to ensure the sales\-floor is adequately stocked. Maintain visual standards required by Wayfair and Tanger Outlets.
* Participate in operational store activities as needed: bringing new products to the floor, floor sets, replenishment, substitutions and general store upkeep.
* Bring a willingness to share innovative ideas and solutions to continuously improve team operations.
* Live by, emulate, and guide by our People Principles every day.

title: Senior Marketing Analyst, B2B Paid Search
description:
* **At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.**


**Senior Marketing Analyst, B2B Paid Search**


**Who We Are**:



The Marketing team is responsible for catapulting Wayfair into the leading destination for all things home by building and evolving customer recognition and attachment to our brands, across all Wayfair stores, geographies, and our extended family of brands. This role is focused on finding, educating, \& acquiring prospective business customers to our fastest growing consumer program, Wayfair Professional (B2B) as well as driving repeat revenue from existing business customers.



As a B2B Paid Search Analyst, you will play a pivotal role on our Marketing team overseeing SEM efforts on Paid Search where you will be shaping the future of B2B advertising through keyword search strategies. Your goal will be to unleash the full potential of SEM ensuring that every initiative propels our business KPIs forward with impressive efficiency.



In the immediate term, you'll dive into channel operations, fine\-tuning ad budgets, ROAS targets, and audience targets to reach the right businesses. You’ll also conduct insightful investigations into recent performance trends, identifying key drivers of success and areas for improvement. Looking towards the future, you'll spearhead innovative testing strategies that align seamlessly with our overarching company objectives, setting the stage for sustained growth and impactful results on these new channels.



This is not just another role—it's an opportunity to lead strategic initiatives that spark innovation and directly influence our business impact. Expect collaboration with stakeholders across the B2B Organization, MarTech/Data Engineering, Marketing, Creative, and other critical teams, fostering connections that amplify your contributions. Join us and drive forward the next wave of B2B marketing excellence!

  


**What You’ll Do:**


* Weekly analysis of core business KPIs with an eye towards understanding the full\-funnel impact of underlying drivers
* Own the end\-to\-end customer journey for our SEM Paid Search channels
* Close partnership with stakeholder teams to educate our marketing strategy combined with seamless customer experience
* Maintain and improve our marketing strategy to ensure flawless customer journey and efficient ad performance
* Build a testing strategy and roadmap for SEM channels to improve capturing prospective businesses as well as driving more repeat revenue. Includes conducting statistical analysis to validate results and inform a rollout decision.
* Own quarterly business plan forecasting for your channels
* Contribute positively to the team and Wayfair culture

  


**What You’ll Need:**


* A minimum of at least a bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Data Science, or Analytics
* 2\- years experience as an analyst or comparable working background preferably in the Search Marketing space
* Experience with SQL \& GBQ. Additional experience with Python preferred.
* Analytical self\-driven thinker who looks for (and finds) answers in the data
* Strong storytelling abilities to contextualize data for broader work groups
* Incredible attention to detail and highly organized
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
* Fast learner who can adapt to new processes and tools on the fly
* Demonstrated ability to effectively prioritize projects and multitask to get things done
* Collaborative team player with the ability to manage stakeholders across levels
* Detail\-oriented professional who thrives on bringing structure to ambiguous problems.
* Analytical powerhouse with a knack for defect\-free analysis and critical thinking.
* Passionate about staying ahead of the curve, embracing new technologies and trends.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills to captivate stakeholders with your insights.


**This is a hybrid position located in our Boston HQ. M\-Th are in office, Fridays are remote.**

description:

Location: Lynnfield, MA



The pay for this position is $21\-24/hr however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience.



Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring for our AllModern retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, this store might be the future home for your career.

  


**What you’ll do:**


* Provide an authentic, friendly customer experience that exemplifies our Wayfair commitment to relentless customer focus.
* Manage, maintain and monitor stock levels, receive and process merchandise, ensure items are properly stored, and easily located for replenishment on the sales floor.
* Provide coaching and support to Operations/Visual Associates and support their allocated workload efforts as determined by the Store Leader. Depending on the specific work shift, this associate will help open and/or close the store, with keyholder responsibilities.
* Support associates to help drive exceptional customer service and maintain a strong visible presence in the designated work area to drive sales and strong customer service.
* Support Store Leaders to train and develop associates on knowledge of our product, selling, customer service, operations, visual, and other aspects of their roles.
* Along with the Store Manager, provide helpful observation feedback and thoughtful guidance to associates to aid them to adapt and grow.

* Utilize sales analytics tools to drive store profitability and growth in a way that supports the success of the overall brand.
* Drive sales in the store by asking great questions to understand customer needs, guiding them through their questions, providing product options (both within store and our endless aisle/online assortment via web and app) that leads to a satisfied customer experience.
* Assist walk\-ins on the sales floor and in the design studio as needed.
* Bring a willingness to share innovative ideas and solutions to continuously improve team operations.
* Engage in a high energy, focused and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions, offerings and operations.

  


**What you’ll need:**


* 2\+ years of retail experience; preferably in the home or furnishing space. Interior design , furniture, or home goods experience preferred.
* An ability to read, interpret and execute a sales floor design layout map or basic planogram experience, preferred.
* Basic electrical wiring experience, preferred
* Experience in visual merchandising ( lighting installs, wallpapering, furniture assembly, preferred.
* Passion for great customer service, operational excellence, and efficiency to meet company goals.
* Track record of thriving in a fast paced and changing environment.

--------------------------

title: Retail Asset Protection & Loss Prevention Specialist
description:
**Asset Protection Specialist (Full\-Time) \- Wayfair Stores**



Location: Wilmette, IL



The pay rate of this role is $19\.00/hr


**Overview:**



As an **Asset Protection Specialist**, you’ll play a critical role in ensuring a safe, secure, and welcoming environment for Wayfair associates, customers, and visitors. You will actively monitor and respond to security and safety concerns, providing support during emergencies and maintaining the integrity of Wayfair’s operations. With a focus on professionalism, customer service, and proactive problem\-solving, this role is essential to protecting Wayfair’s people, assets, and reputation. The ideal candidate thrives in a dynamic environment, collaborating with leadership and Wayfair teams to implement safety protocols and deliver peace of mind to everyone who walks through our doors.


**What Does an Asset Protection Specialist Do?**

  

* **Engage and Protect:** Build trust and confidence by greeting visitors, contractors, and employees with a professional and approachable demeanor. Provide assistance and guidance while maintaining a secure environment.
* **Monitor and Respond:** Actively oversee security systems, including CCTV, access control, and alarms, to identify and address potential risks. Respond promptly to incidents, emergencies, or safety concerns, ensuring the safety of all individuals on\-site.
* **Demonstrate Reliability:** Attendance and punctuality are crucial to maintaining a secure environment. Proactively communicate and plan for any unexpected events to ensure consistent coverage and support.
* **Always Be Vigilant:** Approach every shift with a proactive mindset, identifying and addressing potential security risks before they escalate. Maintain detailed records of incidents, daily activities, and safety assessments to support continuous improvement.
* **Provide Safety Expertise:** Leverage your knowledge of all site\-specific policies and security protocols. Implement emergency response procedures and access control systems to ensure compliance with Wayfair’s safety standards. Conduct regular safety assessments and resolve issues promptly.
* **Support Operational Excellence:** Collaborate with the Asset Protection Manager and Lead on investigations, initiatives, and safety training. Assist in maintaining a clean, organized, and secure environment for all.
* **Adapt to a Fast\-Paced Environment:** Thrive in a dynamic setting with rapidly changing priorities, maintaining focus and composure during high\-pressure situations.
* **Deliver Exceptional Service:** Commit to providing a safe and welcoming experience for everyone at Wayfair. Handle sensitive situations with discretion, professionalism, and empathy, ensuring confidentiality and trust.


**What are the Job Requirements?**


* **Asset Protection \& Security Experience:** 1\+ year of experience in asset protection, security, or a related field required. (Experience with access control systems \& CCTV systems is a plus.)
* **Educational Background:** High school diploma or equivalent required.
* **Flexible Availability:** You must be available to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends, and some holidays.
* **Customer\-Facing Experience:** 1\+ year of customer service experience in a retail or customer\-facing environment is preferred.
* **Physical Capabilities:** Ability to stand and walk for prolonged periods and lift up to 50 pounds unassisted.
* **Technical Proficiency:** Comfortable using Google Workspace, including Gmail, Google Sheets, and other tools, with the ability to learn and navigate necessary security and operational systems.
* **Core Competencies:** Strong professionalism, independent judgment, and discretion in handling sensitive or confidential situations. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills to effectively document incidents and interact professionally with individuals at all levels.
* **Time Management \& Multitasking:** Proven ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple responsibilities simultaneously, and maintain focus and accuracy in a fast\-paced environment.


**Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements**:


* Physical Demands
* + Frequent movement including standing, stooping, kneeling, crouching
	+ Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
	+ Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
	+ Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
	+ Ability to ascend/descend stairs and balance
* Working Environment
* + Some exposure to cold, heat, and humidity
	+ Occasional noise and vibrations
	+ Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes

**What are the Benefits\*?**


* **Competitive Pay:** Earn competitive compensation with regular opportunities for performance\-based increases.
* **Career Growth:** Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
* **Health Benefits from Day One:** Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
* **Time to Recharge:** Start accruing paid time off immediately—because work\-life balance matters.
* **401(k) with Company Match:** We’ll match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
* **Tuition Reimbursement:** Eligible after 6 months of employment—learn, grow, and get support along the way.
* **Wayfair Employee Discount:** Save big on the pieces you love—plus get 10% off at our in\-store restaurant ️.
* **Parental Leave Options:** Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.
* ✨ \***And So Much More:** We’ve got more good stuff where that came from! Our full\-time roles receive the full benefits package, while part\-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in\-store team can help with any questions!

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. title: Flex Warehouse Associate
description:
***The pay for this position is $19\.25/hr***


We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!

 **Shifts:**

* 4 hour shifts available
* Work up to 28 hours per week

**Wayfair Benefits**

* $1\.50/hr Shift Differential for hours worked between 6:00pm \- 6:00am
* Weekly Pay (Fridays)
* Referral bonus
* Wayfair company discount
* Dozens of discounts and perks with partners!

**What You'll Do**

* Unload and receive inbound furniture orders which will require manually moving large, heavy goods.
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 pounds unassisted and maneuvering product 150\+ pounds unassisted or via team lift.
* Use scan technology to document pertinent carton level information, including condition, quantity, and warehouse location of material.
* Proactively monitor order management systems to ensure that all orders have been received properly and that detailed descriptions are provided for any Overage/Shortage/Damage issues.
* Perform regular cycle counts to ensure inventory is accurate and up to date.
* Pick deliveries from inventory and stage them by truck and stop number.
* Provide direct input into the existing user tools and make recommendations for improvements based on your everyday experience.
* Be a vocal contributor on the team.
* Work effectively with peers and managers.
* Identify the most efficient way to complete assigned tasks and asks clarifying questions when appropriate.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.
* Be cross trained in other departments and required to perform additional responsibilities as assigned

**What You'll Need**

* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 lbs. unassisted and moving product 150\+ lbs. unassisted or via team lift.
* Must be able to work on warehouse floor 8 hours a day or more.
* Strong, consistent work ethic.
* Comfort with scanning technology.
* Experience in Distribution or Logistics is a plus.
* Experience working in High Jump is a plus.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.

title: Sr. B2B Sales Specialist, Wayfair Stores
description:
**Sr. B2B Sales Specialist, Wayfair Stores**  

  

*The hourly compensation for this role is $24/hr.*  

  

**Overview:**  

  

At Wayfair, we’re transforming the way businesses shop for their spaces—and as an in\-store **B2B Sales Specialist**, you’ll be on the front lines of that mission. This isn’t your typical sales role. You’ll act as a trusted partner to local businesses, helping them discover the power of Wayfair Professional and our in\-store design expertise. Whether it’s a boutique hotel redesign, a new office buildout, or ongoing projects for local contractors, such as Interior Designers, you’ll be their go\-to guide for all things Wayfair.



This role blends sales development, community building, and hands\-on customer support. You’ll grow our professional customer base by connecting with new prospects, activating and growing business from existing accounts, and working closely with in\-store teams to bring large\-scale projects to life. At Wayfair, we believe in hustle *and* heart—and in this role, you’ll find both.



Ready to drive impact, grow your pipeline, and help businesses bring their visions to life? Let’s make it happen.

  

**What Does a B2B Sales Specialist Do?**


* **Grow the B2B Business:** Build relationships with local Wayfair Professional customers—both new and existing—by prospecting, cold calling, and community engagement. Your goal? Drive awareness, increase in\-store program adoption, and help businesses unlock the full potential of the Wayfair Professional Program.
* **Engage Local Wayfair Professional Customers:** Proactively reach out to existing and potential B2B customers in the local market to promote the value of our in\-store experience, encourage visits, and connect them with our Design Specialists. Reengage inactive accounts and uncover new opportunities through tailored outreach and relationship\-building strategies.
* **Prospect Net\-New Customers:** Use online research, walk\-ins, and cold outreach to connect with business owners across industries. You’ll validate enrollment status, pitch program benefits, and help them get started with Wayfair Professional.
* **Build Local Partnerships:** Develop relationships with area business associations, real estate developers, and design industry organizations. Share insights and collaborate with the home office to scale successful partnership models across markets.
* **Coordinate Events:** Partner with store leadership and marketing to host monthly in\-store B2B events and identify opportunities for community engagement that showcase Wayfair’s offerings and expertise.
* ️ **Support B2B Projects In\-Store:** Act as the go\-to B2B expert for store teams and customers alike. You’ll answer program questions, connect customers to the right design and delivery services, and support complex or large\-scale orders.
* **Enable the Team:** Educate associates on B2B tools, benefits, and workflows. Collaborate closely with our instore and virtual Sales teams to ensure a seamless handoff for customers visiting our store from remote channels.

  


**You’ll Thrive in this Role if You Have:**


* **Sales Drive:** 2\-3 years of general sales experience with a proven track record of hitting or exceeding goals—preference in B2B development or trade environments.
* ️ **Retail Know\-How:** 1–2 years of retail experience working with customers, ideally in high\-touch or specialty sales settings.
* **Great Communication:** You’re comfortable building rapport over the phone, in person, or via email. You know how to listen, engage, and follow up like a pro.
* ️ **Organizational Excellence:** You can juggle multiple priorities without dropping the ball—whether it's planning outreach, logging customer notes in Salesforce, or coordinating an event.
* **Strategic Thinking:** You’re proactive in identifying opportunities, digging into data, and thinking three steps ahead to unlock growth.
* **Tech Comfort:** You’re familiar with CRMs (Salesforce), POS systems, and productivity tools like Google Suite.
* **Team Collaboration:** You thrive in a fast\-paced, cross\-functional environment and love partnering with others to drive results.
* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree required.
* **Flexible Availability:** Able to work full\-time, including peak business hours, to support the needs of B2B customers in\-store.
* **Ability to Travel:** You will be required to travel locally as needed to meet with customers, businesses, or partners. Typically this will fall within a 50\-mile radius.

  


**Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:**


* **Physical Activity:**Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
* **Mobility \& Movement:** Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
* **Lifting Ability:** Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs regularly.
* **Vision Requirements:** Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
* ️ **Temperature Flexibility:** Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
* **Noise Tolerance:** Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
* + ️ **Safety Awareness:** Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazards—must adhere to all safety protocols.

  

**What are the Benefits\*?**


* **Competitive Pay:** Earn competitive compensation, with regular opportunities for performance\-based increases and performance based bonuses.
* **Career Growth:** Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
* **Health Benefits from Day One:** Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
* **Time to Recharge:** Start accruing paid time off immediately—because work\-life balance matters.
* **401(k) with Company Match:** We’ll match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
* **Tuition Reimbursement:** Eligible after 6 months of employment—learn, grow, and get support along the way.
* **Wayfair Employee Discount:** Save big on the pieces you love—plus get 10% off at our in\-store restaurant ️.
* **Parental Leave Options:** Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.
* ✨ **And So Much More:** We’ve got more good stuff where that came from! NOTE: our full\-time roles receive the full benefits package above, while part\-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in\-store team can help with any questions!

 **About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. title: Wayfair Outlet Assistant Store Manager
description:
**Wayfair Outlet Assistant Store Manager**


**The position is based in Chandler, AZ**



Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring an Assistant Store Manager for our returns Outlet retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, Wayfair’s Outlet store might be the future home for your career.


**What you’ll do:**


* As an authentic brand ambassador for the Wayfair family, lead and create a best in class customer experience by connecting them with the world's biggest and best home online assortment brought to life in our stores.
* Assist the Store Manager in bringing the Wayfair brand family to life by building a high performing customer centric team, and actively linking them in an authentic way to all channels.
* Lead and develop a team of Sales Associates to meet sales goals
* Master our brand story and be able to share our brand with polished communication, personal appearance and professionalism.
* Consistently recruit, hire, and retain a salesforce that delights and inspires our customers while driving sales.
* Build a talent pipeline, both internal and external, to deliver budgeted sales and best in class customer experience
* Build schedules that allow for best in class customer service, meet all operational business requirements and are fair and balanced for associates.
* Maintain leadership presence through effective floor management and resource allocation.
* Identify customers’ needs, and balance with operational requirements to meet customer experience standards.
* Perform opening and closing routines and provide supervision to ensure the store is meeting financial goals and associates are providing best in class service to our customers.
* Foster and instill a culture of accountability and continuous feedback to promote a profitable, positive, and dynamic environment.
* Assist the Store Manager in leading a team to always use good judgment; demonstrate a culture of ethical conduct, security, and compliance.
* Ensure the team feels supported and inspired daily; Treat all personnel internally and externally with respect, empathy, and inclusion.
* Manage stockroom organization and supply levels to maximize efficiency, safety and productivity to support sales floor replenishment.
* Utilize sales analytics tools to drive store profitability and growth in a way that supports the success of the overall brand.
* Manage and monitor stock levels, merchandise adjacencies, presentations, signing, and assortment in all departments to ensure the sales\-floor is adequately stocked. Maintain visual standards required by Wayfair and Tanger Outlets.
* Participate in operational store activities as needed: bringing new products to the floor, floor sets, replenishment, substitutions and general store upkeep.
* Bring a willingness to share innovative ideas and solutions to continuously improve team operations.
* Live by, emulate, and guide by our People Principles every day.


**Physical Requirements:**


* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.


**Work Schedule:**  

At Wayfair and our family of brands, we strive to provide our employees with a work schedule that protects their work/life balance and takes their scheduling preferences into consideration. Please understand due to the nature of the retail industry, your shift schedule will vary. However, we will work to provide you with your schedule a minimum of 2 weeks in advance, and you will have the opportunity to trade with teammates as needed.

We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!

 **Shifts:**

* 4 hour shifts available
* Work up to 28 hours per week

**Wayfair Benefits**

* $1\.50/hr Shift Differential for hours worked between 6:00pm \- 6:00am
* Weekly Pay (Fridays)
* Referral bonus
* Wayfair company discount
* Dozens of discounts and perks with partners!

**What You'll Do**

* Unload and receive inbound furniture orders which will require manually moving large, heavy goods.
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 pounds unassisted and maneuvering product 150\+ pounds unassisted or via team lift.
* Use scan technology to document pertinent carton level information, including condition, quantity, and warehouse location of material.
* Proactively monitor order management systems to ensure that all orders have been received properly and that detailed descriptions are provided for any Overage/Shortage/Damage issues.
* Perform regular cycle counts to ensure inventory is accurate and up to date.
* Pick deliveries from inventory and stage them by truck and stop number.
* Provide direct input into the existing user tools and make recommendations for improvements based on your everyday experience.
* Be a vocal contributor on the team.
* Work effectively with peers and managers.
* Identify the most efficient way to complete assigned tasks and asks clarifying questions when appropriate.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.
* Be cross trained in other departments and required to perform additional responsibilities as assigned

**What You'll Need**

* Minimum 6 months of cherry picker experience required. Must be comfortable with heights (40ft)
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 lbs. unassisted and moving product 150\+ lbs. unassisted or via team lift.
* Must be able to work on warehouse floor 8 hours a day or more.
* Strong, consistent work ethic.
* Comfort with scanning technology.
* Experience in Distribution or Logistics is a plus.
* Experience working in High Jump is a plus.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.


**Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities**  

Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. As part of this commitment, Wayfair will make reasonable accommodations to the known physical or mental limitations of qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on business operations. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, please let us know by completing our Accomodations for Applicants form.  

  

**Need Technical Assistance?**  

For more information about applying for a career at wayfair, visit our FAQ page here.  

  

**About Wayfair Inc.**  

Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.
