title: Wayfair Outlet Retail Sales Associate - Part Time
description:
**Wayfair Outlet \- Sales Associate**
=====================================



Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring a Sales Associate for our returns Outlet retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, Wayfair’s Outlet store might be the future home for your career. **Starting rate: $16 per hour** **Hours**: 20 hours per week
***Store hours:***

Monday \-Thursday: 10AM\-8PM

Friday \-Saturday: 10AM\-9PM
Sunday: 10AM\-7PM
*Weekends and dayshift availability is required for this role.*  



**Benefits to building a HOME for your career with Wayfair:**

* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)
* Wayfair company discount
* 401(k) with company match
* Referral bonuses
  


**What you’ll do:**
* As an authentic brand ambassador for the Wayfair family, lead and create a best in class customer experience by connecting them with the world's biggest and best home online assortment brought to life in our stores.
* Greet customers as they walk in the store
* Assist at the cash wrap as needed
* Participate in operational aspects of the store, including receiving and replenishment
* Exemplify a positive and professional attitude
* Engage in a high energy, focused and dynamic work environment
* Support launch efforts with set\-up responsibilities such as unloading trucks, moving and unpacking boxes, building furniture, stocking shelves and cleaning
* Perform other duties as assigned by the shift supervisor
* Follow all company policies and Wayfair standards

 **Criteria:**
* Customer service experience preferred, but open to entry\-level
* Passion for great customer service and a drive to exceed sales targets


* Strong organization, self\-motivation, communication and relationship management skills.


* Comfortable working in a fast paced and changing environment
* Technical acumen to learn necessary software
* Associates are expected to have availability to meet the needs of the business.
* All employees will be expected to represent the brand through polished communication, personal appearance and professionalism

  


**Essential Functions:**
* Excellent verbal communication skills
* Excellent active listening skills
* Excellent sales and customer service skills
* Ability to anticipate customers' needs
* Technical acumen to learn necessary software and systems
* Ability to process information and merchandise through a computer system and POS register system


**Physical Requirements:**
--------------------------


* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus

 **Working Hours:**

At Wayfair and our family of brands, we strive to provide our employees with a work schedule that protects their work/life balance and takes their scheduling preferences into consideration. Please understand due to the nature of the retail industry, your shift schedule will vary. However, we will work to provide you with your schedule a minimum of 2 weeks in advance, and you will have the opportunity to trade with teammates as needed.  

Our store hours are Monday\-Thursday 10:00AM \- 8:00PM, Friday \- Saturday 10am \- 9pm and Sundays 10:00AM \- 7:00PM. Employee shifts may include an hour before or after store hours.

  

Employment/promotion to this role will be contingent on successful completion of a background check.

Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. As part of this commitment, Wayfair will make reasonable accommodations to the known physical or mental limitations of qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on business operations. title: Senior Product Manager, Shipment Execution
description:
**Who We Are**


*This position will comply with our hybrid work model and be expected to sit in our Boston, MA headquarters 3 days/week (T/W/TH)*



Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our Product team plays a critical role in making this vision a reality by building technology that solves meaningful customer problems in elegant, scalable, and measurable ways. We work closely with Engineering, Experience Design, Analytics, Third Party system and service providers and business leaders across the company to bring these solutions to life.

  



We are seeking an experienced Senior Product Manager for Supply Chain and Retail Technology to lead a strategic initiative focused on transforming our last mile delivery platform. This includes integrating with third\-party execution systems and logistics partners to streamline and scale delivery operations across North America and the UK. In this role, you will optimize the end\-to\-end shipment execution lifecycle for a diverse carrier landscape to reduce friction in the delivery process, and strong business performance.

  



You’ll act as a connective tissue between engineering, business stakeholders, operations, and external partners to deliver scalable and resilient solutions that power key business functions. This is a high\-impact role for someone who thrives in cross\-functional environments, can manage complex technical ecosystems, and is passionate about building foundational infrastructure that improves operational efficiency.

  


**What you’ll Do:**


* **Own the long\-term (18\+ month) product strategy and near\-term (6\+ month) roadmap** for platform tools that integrate with third\-party execution systems, prioritizing features that deliver meaningful business impact.
* **Understand Wayfair’s transportation order execution processes** and supporting systems, identifying ways to improve efficiency and reduce friction.
* **Lead discovery efforts** to gather and translate internal and external partner needs into clear business and technical requirements.
* **Collaborate independently** with stakeholders, internal technology teams across supply chain, storefront and supplier\-facing to drive improvements in speed, cost and customer experience metrics.
* **Work closely with Engineering, Operations, Commercial, and External partners** to deliver on your roadmap and improve team execution.
* **Plan the phase\-out of legacy systems** with strategies that ensure a smooth transition to modern solutions without hindering business continuity.

  


**We Are A Match Because You Have:**

  


* 7\+ years of product management experience, ideally focused on platforms, APIs, or integrations.
* Comfortable discussing API design, architecture decisions, and system workflows with engineers.
* Strong track record of leading third\-party system integrations (e.g., TMS, ERP) and ability to manage 6\+ month roadmap delivery with them.
* Strong communicator with a proven ability to collaborate across engineering, operations, and external partners. Experienced in managing complex projects involving 7\+ cross\-functional teams. Clear, effective writing is essential and expected in this role.
* Skilled at managing stakeholders, including senior leadership, and translating technical concepts for non\-technical audiences.
* Positive, collaborative, and energetic approach to teamwork.

  


**Why You’ll Love Wayfair**


* Time Off:
* + Paid Holidays
	+ Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Health \& Wellness:
* + Full Health Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA)
	+ Life Insurance
	+ Disability Protection (Short Term \& Long Term Disability)
	+ Global Wellbeing: Gym/Fitness discounts (including US Peloton, Global ClassPass, and various regional gym memberships)
	+ Mental Health Support (Global Mental Health, Global Wayhealthy Recordings)
	+ Caregiver Services
* Financial Growth \& Security:
* + 401K Matching (Employee Matching Program)
	+ Tuition Reimbursement
	+ Financial Health Education (Knowledge of Financial Education \- KOFE)
	+ Tax Advantaged Accounts
* Family Support:
* + Family Planning Support
	+ Parental Leave
	+ Global Surrogacy \& Adoption Policy
* Professional Development \& Recognition:

title: Part-time Furniture Repair Technician
description:
The starting pay for this position is $36\.62/hour.  

We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair! **Shift**
Friday and Saturday 9:30 pm \- 8 am **Wayfair Benefits**
Referral bonus
Wayfair company discount
Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!) **What You'll Do*** Work independentlyto evaluate damages and defects of items and determine if items can be repaired. Make any required adjustments to items ahead of delivery and ensure item is in perfect condition to be delivered to the customer
* Prioritize and execute on daily, weekly, and monthly tasks (repairs) to ensure completion in a effective and timely manner
* Accurately reports outcomes of work in progress, completed, \& past due work
* Monitors inventory, and orders replacement parts and complete installs as needed
* Ask clarifying questions when appropriate
* Administer appropriate repair methods for various product types including, but not limited to:
* + Evaluate each piece of furniture to determine the type of wood and/or upholstery repairs, parts, and materials needed to complete the job
	+ Case Goods: Burn\-ins, refinishing, joinery, match colors, and simulate wood grain
	+ Refinishes and patches damaged furniture including paint, stain, enamel or lacquers; mixes paints and stains to match existing finish
	+ Repairs, replaces and rebuilds damaged wood, leather or upholstery furniture or mechanical parts
	+ Operates tools such as power drills, sanders, saws, and other tools required for repair
* Use scan technology to document pertinent carton level information, including condition, quantity, warehouse location and detail repair completed
* Provide direct input into the existing user tools and make recommendations for improvements based on expertise \& experience
* Be a vocal contributor on the team
* Contribute to the building and development of training materials for applicable functions
* Must understand that this role will require you to work cooperatively with others, adjust to change, be a reliable team member, and work with other towards a common goal

 **What You'll Need*** At least 5\+ years prior experience in furniture repair/construction
* Advanced understanding of repairing wood items including: color and stain matching, damage/defect repair
* Ability to use power and hand tools as needed
* Advanced understanding of repairing upholstery and multiple fabric types a plus
* High attention to detail and prioritizes quality to deliver a perfect item to the customer.
* Must be comfortable lifting up to 75 lbs. unassisted and moving product 150\+ lbs. unassisted or via team lift
* Must be able to work on warehouse floor 8 hours a day or more
* Strong, consistent work ethic and ability to manage time effectively
* Comfort with scanning technology.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.
* Must be at least 18 years of age.
* Certification in Furniture Repair/Restoration, preferred

 **Safety**
The safety of employees remains our \#1 priority and is at the heart of every decision made. We have taken a variety of steps to ensure that Wayfair is one of the safest places to work by:* Providing Guidelines to help employees maintain proper social distancing
* Providing and requiring suitable PPE such as masks, gloves, and safety vests.
* Increased sanitizing stations, as well as, improved professional sanitization of each facility.
* Team stretches at the start of each shift \- if you've come to flex your muscles, you first have to stretch them!

title: Sr. Digital Merchandising Manager, Perigold
description:
*The salary range (or base pay) for this position is $149,000\-161,000 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.*


*This position is a hybrid in\-office role that works out of our Headquarters in Boston, MA (this role is not a virtual / remote position). 4 days in office/ 1 day WFH*



The Perigold Merchandising Lead role (Sr Manager) is responsible for setting and executing on the vision of best\-in\-class merchandising for Perigold. They will partner closely with STO leads across Category Management, Marketing, Merchandising, Operations and Storefront to identify opportunities for merchandising optimization and utilize the team of associates, analysts and offshore resources to directly improve the Perigold merchandising experience, through e.g. scalable catalog cleanups, merchandising lever optimizations and automation, dashboard creation and alerting setup, and partnering on new go\-to\-market content.


**About Perigold**: Perigold is the destination for luxury home. Established in 2017, Perigold offers an unmatched selection of the world’s best design brands with unique pieces for every style and space. The brand offers the highest quality pieces for your home, backed by a quality guarantee and expert concierge support. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Perigold is part of the Wayfair Inc. (NYSE:W) brand portfolio.


**What You’ll Do:**


* Own merchandising metrics for the PG catalog and onsite experience, including complete SKU %, assortment reporting, catalog health, merchandising productivity.
* Build and execute on 12\-18 month roadmap.
* Identify opportunities for scalable optimization of the catalog \& experience, working with direct reports and offshore resources to improve coverage metrics.
* Partner closely with merchandising teams on nuanced merchandising needed by customer type, category or platform.
* Manage a team of 5 associates and analysts, identifying opportunities for team development throughout the roadmap and promoting collaboration within the team.
* Manage offshore resources and optimize workflows to get optimal benefit from cost.
* Work cross\-functionally with category management and marketing to solve Perigold\-wide problems, including collaborating on assortment optimization, go\-to\-market content, site navigation and supplier management.
* Build out business reporting needs and prioritize within the Merchandising analytics community.


**What You’ll Need:**


* 7\+ years of experience or 1\+ years post MBA experience preferred.
* 2\+ years management experience preferred.
* Bachelor's Degree required.
* Strong analytical orientation, capable of leveraging data to dissect complex problems, formulate testable hypotheses, rigorously verify those hypotheses through data analysis, and ultimately develop and implement well\-supported recommendations.
* A keen eye for premium product presentation, understanding the nuances of visual merchandising and branding that elevate the perceived value of products.
* Senior presence coupled with strong communication skills, capable of articulating ideas clearly and persuasively.
* Exceptional stakeholder management skills, adept at building and maintaining positive relationships across teams and levels, effectively managing expectations, and driving collaborative outcomes.

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. title: Senior Merchandising Manager, Digital, Housewares & More
description:
*The salary range (or base pay) for this position is $149,000\-161,000 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.*


*This position is a hybrid in\-office role that works out of our Headquarters in Boston, MA (this role is not a virtual / remote position). 4 days in office/ 1 day WFH*



Lead Product Merchandising strategy and implementation for Housewares \& More vertical. Responsible for defining the best in class online shopping experience and strategy that aligns with business objectives and customer needs. The ideal candidate will be innovative, enthusiastic, and customer\-focused with great judgment, creative problem\-solving skills, technical skills, and experience leading teams and working cross\-functionally. This is a unique opportunity to advocate for the needs of our customers and serve as the go\-to person for insight on vertical customer experience perspectives.


**What You'll Do**


* Define, design and drive a best in class customer shopping experience for your product categories.
* Analyze site metrics, customer research, competitors and related data to identify opportunities to improve the customer experience.
* Develop and manage execution of roadmaps for your vertical in collaboration with cross\-functional stakeholders, that drives impact for product categories.
* Manage, coach, and develop a team.
* Drive improvements to the customer and shopping experience through the development and implementation of strategic tests (including competitor research) and cross\-functional projects that will improve the customer experience and drive an increased conversion rate and revenue growth.
* Define content strategy and develop / test inspirational, educational, and effective landing pages.
* Collaborate with various teams across Technology and Commercial on projects to represent the requirements and needs of your customer and category experience, drive completion and ensure cohesive customer experience across all touch points.
* Communicate findings and results with senior leaders, acting as a member of the broader ‘single threaded’ team within your vertical and act as an advocate for the end\-to\-end customer experience, synthesizing multiple points of view and owning a coherent action plan, all while negotiating and influencing others.


**What You'll Need**


* 7\+ years of experience or 1\+ years post MBA experience preferred.
* 2\+ years management experience preferred.
* Bachelor's Degree required.
* Passion for and experience improving customer outcomes through improved features and/or digital experiences; preferably within ecommerce.
* Strong analytical skills; ability to extract insights from large and varied data sets to inform strategy and decision\-making.
* Excellent communication, leadership, and culture building skills.
* Organized, process\-oriented, strategic problem solver with talent to multitask in a fast\-paced and entrepreneurial environment, with a bias for customer focused innovation.
* Able to think outside the box and challenge the status quo, while also fairly evaluating all possible solutions in making strategic decisions.
* Quickly learn the necessary technical tools in order to coach and develop your team.

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. title: Maintenance Mechanic 3
description:
The pay for this position is $38\.61/hr


Shifts available:


Mon\-Fri 5pm\-1:30am

**Maintenance Mechanic III**


We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!


The Maintenance Mechanic III will be a highly self\-motivated, customer\-centric team player with the ability to work independently and lead other team members designing solutions for difficult problems, managing outside contractors, working on call for emergencies and leading multiple projects and daily activities under tight timelines.

**What You’ll Do**

* Work independently without supervision to troubleshoot all conveyor material handling systems, electrical, plumbing, mechanical, and fire protection systems
* Develop and execute plans to accomplish departmental and operational goals
* Design, layout, and reconfiguration of existing systems as necessary
* Utilize CMMS system to create, maintain and validate team’s work schedule and workflow
* Work regularly on aerial platform lifts, boom/snorkel lifts, and powered industrial trucks (reach, order picker, stand up, pallet runners, stock chaser, etc.)
* Mentor team members by motivating, providing guidance and direct feedback to help them achieve their goals, improve individual performance and seek out training opportunities on more technical functions
* Develop and maintain good working relationships across all levels of the organization
* Responsible for keeping and maintaining tools, supplies, and a clean, organized work area
* Will perform emergency repairs in high pressure circumstances

 **What You’ll Need**

  

* Minimum 5\+ years experience in industrial maintenance and/or combined certification(s)
* Ability to lead, mentor and train team members
* Proficient reading and comprehending electrical schematics and using associated tools such as volt/ohm meter, etc. (120,240,480VAC, 24VDC)
* Ability to install, maintain, \& troubleshoot relay logic, ladder diagrams, control components, photo eyes, motor starters, relays, limit switches, proximity sensors, timers, solenoids, servo drives, frequency inverters, linear drives, and encoders
* Proficient using hand \& power tools and electrical testing equipment
* Advanced understanding of HMIs and PLC systems including verifying inputs and outputs and controls
* Experienced safely using warehouse equipment such as order pickers, pallet jacks, forklifts and aerial lifts
* Proficient using computer systems and CMMS software
* Will be required to wear applicable personal protective equipment including arc flash protection and safety shoes
* Ability to regularly bend, lift, stretch, crawl and reach, engage in full manual dexterity in both hands and wrists and stand and walk for long periods
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 lbs unassisted
* Ability to access all areas of the building by climbing ladders and gangways safely and without limitation
* Ability to work in a non\-climate controlled environment that can be noisy and have a low lighting levels
* Follow all company safety policies, procedures, and guidelines
* Ability to work independently, as part of a team and take directions
* Must be a safety conscious, motivated, detail oriented, self\-starter with a positive attitude
* Must be flexible on working hours and willing to work scheduled \& unscheduled overtime

  

 About Us


Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. description:

We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. * Wed \- Sat 9:30 PM \- 8 AM

* $1\.50 Shift differential after 6:00pm
* Referral bonuses

* Benefits start day one

**What You'll Do**


* The Warehouse Team Lead will assist your supervisor with managing and overseeing all functions of the warehouse, and ensuring smooth operations of all activities
* Lead the receiving department and ensure the functions are used correctly
* Delegate and assign work to keep a 100% fill rate
* Help manage the inventory and conduct necessary training within the department

* Experience with composing and replying to emails
* Power Equipment experience – Must be able to operate or willing to be trained on Powered Industrial Truck Operations (PITO)

description:
**Wayfair Outlet \- Retail Receiving Associate**
================================================

  



Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring a Retail Receiving Associate for our returns Outlet retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, Wayfair’s Outlet store might be the future home for your career.  

**The pay for this position is:** $16 per hour  


**Our store hours are Monday \- Saturday 10am \- 7pm \& Sunday 10am \- 6pm**
***Receiving team will need to be available for Morning shifts on Tuesday and Friday***
\*\*Employee shifts may include an hour before or after store hours.  


**Benefits to Building a HOME for your career with Wayfair:**
* 401K w/ Company match
* Employee Discounts
* and so much more!

**What you’ll do:**
* As an authentic brand ambassador for the Wayfair family, lead and create a best in class customer experience by connecting them with the world's biggest and best home online assortment brought to life in our stores.
* Manage and monitor stock levels, merchandise adjacencies, presentations, signing, and assortment in all departments to ensure the sales\-floor is adequately stocked. Maintain visual standards required by Wayfair and Tanger Outlets.
* Support customer fulfillment across all channels leveraging all services including (order pick up, incoming inventory).
* Maintaining visual standards, replenishment, safety and backroom standards.
* Participate in all operational aspects of the store including but not limited to: processing new products, floor sets, replenishment, substitutions and general upkeep of the store
* Exemplify a positive and professional attitude on a daily basis with customers and your team members.
* Bring a willingness to share innovative ideas and solutions to continuously improve team operations.
* Engage in a high energy, focused and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions, offerings and operations.
* Assist with furniture delivery to customer's vehicles

 **Criteria:**
* 1\+ years of stock receiving required, retail and/or customer service experience preferred
* Positive attitude and passion for great customer service
* Strong organization, self\-motivation, communication and relationship management skills.
* Demonstrated ability to work within a team environment.
* Proficiency in Google and Microsoft Office applications preferred.
* All employees will be expected to represent the brand through polished communication, personal appearance and professionalism.

 **Essential Functions:**
* Excellent verbal communication skills.
* Excellent active listening skills.
* Positive, professional attitude and demonstrated enthusiasm for supporting customers
* Technical acumen to learn necessary software (google and microsoft office) to manage inventory and price items
* Ability to process information and merchandise through a computer system and POS register system.

 **Physical Requirements:**
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 pounds unassisted and maneuvering product 150\+ pounds unassisted or via team lift.

At Wayfair and our family of brands, we strive to provide our employees with a work schedule that protects their work/life balance and takes their scheduling preferences into consideration. Please understand due to the nature of the retail industry, your shift schedule will vary. However, we will work to provide you with your schedule a minimum of 2 weeks in advance, and you will have the opportunity to trade with teammates as needed.

title: Senior Manager, Advertising Sales and Execution
description:
***At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for this position for the following work visas: F1\-OPT, STEM OPT EAD, H\-1B, H\-1B1, E\-3, O\-1, J\-1, or TN.***

Wayfair's Supplier Advertising (Retail Media Network) team is quickly growing and seeking an experienced, Senior Manager to drive advertising growth in our two largest domestic categories, Upholstery and Casegoods. These categories represented the highest growth opportunities for our retail media network and will require leading a \~8 person team to achieve our aggressive growth targets. This leader within the advertising team will need to be able to balance setting longer term strategic priorities for these categories while being able to go deep with the team to ensure strong results at the supplier level. This individual will be instrumental in leading their teams to profitable revenue growth for new and existing accounts and creating / executing account and sub\-segment customer strategies. The ideal candidate must be highly analytical, hands on, and understand how to effectively drive results in a fast\-paced company.

  


**What You’ll Do:**


* Drive sales strategy and execution of Casegoods and Upholstery, with responsibility for helping our suppliers profitability grow their advertising and ensuring supplier success with using our advertising products
* Serve as the Wayfair success manager for strategic suppliers and execute negotiations to secure best pricing, sales programs, fulfillment performance, and advertising/promotional support
* Defining performance metrics for measurement, comparison, or evaluation of category performance, such as availability, speed, damage/defect rate, cost competitiveness, digital advertising performance, and others
* Analyze data to strategize profit growth opportunities for the category and for specific supplier partners
* Partner closely with senior leaders to develop and enhance the Wayfair brand, site, and competitive positioning
* Analyze competitors’ marketing, selection and pricing and make strategic changes
* Develop strategies for key customer sub\-segments and collaborate with key cross functional teams (e.g., Category Management, Sales Ops, etc.)
* Be a leader within the Supplier Advertising Sales Team and Broader Retail Media organization

  


**What You’ll Need**


* 5\+ years of experience in sales or account management, people management, and leadership.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree, preferred
* Strong verbal and written communications skills.
* Strong presentation skills to all levels of management.
* Ability to work collaboratively across functions and synthesize multiple points of view into a streamlined story and action plan.
* Experience in taking a company forward in a fast\-growth environment, providing insight for direction, and managing change effectively.
* Performance marketing or advertising background a plus

description:
**Night Shift Warehouse Supervisor Jacksonville \- 13483 103rd Street, Jacksonville, FL**


**Shift:**


* **Wed \- Sat 4:45pm \- 3:15am (4x 10hr shift)**

  



We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!


**What You'll Do**


* Supervise the functions and working of the warehouse workers.
* Delegate and assign tasks and targets and evaluate the work of the staff.
* Adhere to the compliance of all legal and safety procedures.
* Supervise proper shift allocations and ensure efficiency of all warehouse staff.
* Organize and conduct necessary training activities for the staff and workers.
* Ensure the proper functioning and safe operations of all warehouse tools and equipment.
* Work effectively with other managers within functional team and supports new team members.
* Drive specific initiatives that have proven business results.
* Proactively think beyond the explicit assignment to ask second\-order questions and identify additional analytic needs.
* Accurately, quickly, and clearly answer questions related to your area of focus.
* Be viewed as a credible company expert on your area of focus.
* Effectively prepare and run internal meetings with supporting analytics and data.
* Additional responsibilities as assigned.


**What You'll Need**


* Bachelor’s or associate degree in management, administration, supply chain, customer service, or 5\+ years working experience in product distribution to customer base.
* Knowledge of the safety and legal documentation processes for handling related warehouse activities (MSDS, Equipment checklist, BOL).
* Working understanding of Warehouse Management System.
* Should have excellent leadership and administration skills and abilities.
* Strong motivational, effectual team building, and decision\-making skills.
* Ability to effectively manage time and resolve crises.
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 pounds unassisted and maneuvering product 150\+ pounds unassisted or via team lift.

title: Manager, Market & Competitive Insights
description:
***At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for this position for the following work visas: F1\-OPT, STEM OPT EAD, H\-1B, H\-1B1, E\-3, O\-1, J\-1, or TN.***

**Who We Are**  


To win in the home goods space, Wayfair has to make strategic decisions with extensive and asymmetric awareness of the competitive landscape. CompIntel acquires the data for competitive insights and decisioning, namely exact competitor matches which power target price for branded products (matching to lowest tier 1 competitor price) and market / competitor price indices, and competitive share tracking via 3rd party credit card and POS data.



We are looking for a Manager to help drive the acquisition and maintenance of product matches, and procure competitive insights to help inform strategic decisions. In this role, you will tightly partner with our Technology team in advancing our match acquisition and maintenance processes with a focus on automation while maintaining accuracy through tight audit processes. To prioritize the right new matches and identify new opportunities in our workflows, you will also tightly partner with leaders across our commercial team, including Pricing and Category Management. As part of the competitive insights workstream, you will closely work with Business Trends and Category leadership to prioritize investigations and share insights. This is a highly visible workstream with exposure up to C\-suite.

  


**What You'll Do**


* Coach \& lead a team of 1\-2 direct reports and indirect oversight of Analysts who own specific subsets of the CompIntel Strategy \& Ops agenda (Branded Matches, Differentiated Matches, Merchandising Analytics, Cross\-store Ops, 3rd party credit card data, POS data, ship speed)
* Maintain our share tracking indices, including the Yipit home pureplay index and the Yipit broad catalog competitors cuts (tracking our share by category / class vs. Amazon, Walmart, Target, Home Depot, Lowe’s and Costco), and manage our global POS relationships (Circana and GFK)
* Help broaden our competitive insights, leveraging 3rd party credit card, POS data, and internal product match / order data. Ensure the plan is aligned with Business Trends and Commercial leadership
* Drive alignment in recurring meetings, including Monthly and Weekly Business Reviews (MBRs and WBRs)
* Manage OKRs for the CompIntel Strategy \& Ops team, and tightly partner with Tech Leadership on aligning on corresponding OKRs in their respective spaces
* Oversee of the Offshore Labor budget
* Drive the prioritization of new CompIntel match acquisition together with Pricing and Category leadership, and identify the most effective approach to acquire these matches
* Regularly retest our current processes and flows, including crawling schedules, match accuracy, cost/match and match rate (the success of finding a match / attempt which is of particular importance for manual matches)
* Work with Technology to identify and prioritize bug fixes (e.g. crawling issues)


**What You'll Need**


* 3\+ years of work experience in analytical, consulting, investment banking, technology, startup, or strategy roles
* Bachelor’s degree from top\-tier institution with a strong academic record in economics, math, statistics, engineering, business or related field is a plus
* Proven track record in driving results along a set of key output metrics and OKRs
* Strong analytical skills – ability to develop analytical hypothesis and assumptions, use data software to conduct analyses, and synthesize findings
* Strong communication skills – ability to succinctly summarize findings and thread a narrative, and share / align messaging with stakeholders
* Strong business acumen – ability to understand how various parts of the business interact, and how CompIntel fits in
* Ability to learn and act quickly, make decisions and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity
* Intellectually curious, high energy, with a strong work ethic and a desire to work in a fast\-paced, high stakes team environment
* Advanced Excel / Google Sheets skills; Experience with SQL or Google Big Query is a plus but not required

 **About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. title: Head of Product - Data & AI
description:
*Candidates for this position must be based in Toronto, Canada or Boston, Massachusetts and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements (T/W/TH in office).*


**Head of Product, Data \& AI**


**Who You Are:**

  



Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. These experiences are driven by a cutting\-edge set of data and machine learning, analytics, and operational systems that work in an integrated fashion to deliver a world class shopping experience for our customers. Business applications of these systems span many fields including recommendations, marketing, supply chain optimization and merchandising. These fields require a sophisticated technology stack that allows for configurability for rapid testing and exploration.

  



We are looking for a seasoned Product leader to join our Platforms Product team to lead a team of Product Managers working on multiple facets of our Data and AI Platforms, including real\-time, batch, analytics, and also Generative AI capabilities. These platforms are leveraged by nearly all our employees for operational and analytical purposes, or for powering our AI applications geared towards internal processes and our customer and supplier experiences.

  



We’re looking for someone who not only enjoys creating a bold vision, but also executing on their ideas through fruition on a global scale. In this role, you will own a range of products that will offer cloud native Data \& AI capabilities to our Engineers, Analysts, and Data Scientists developing customer and supplier\-focused platforms. Your goal will be to empower any team across the company with self\-service software (with data or AI needs) to deploy, manage, and integrate their applications utilizing our data platforms.

  



This person will act with a high degree of freedom and ownership, setting platform vision, forming strong relationships with senior cross\-functional partners (both technical and non\-technical), aligning on a shared vision for success, and delivering results that create meaningful business impact. This Product leader will serve as the subject matter expert, drive adoption for new use cases, and continually improve our platform capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in product management, a deep understanding of data technologies, and a proven track record of leading and developing high\-performing teams.

  


**What You’ll Do:**


* **Product Leadership**: Develop and drive the overall strategy for our Data \& AI Platforms, ensuring alignment with platforms strategy, along with delivering value for your users with in market usable solutions
* **AI Platforms**: Set strategic direction and drive execution for Generative AI capabilities that serve a range of personas, departmental and job function needs, supporting adoption and evangelization across the organization; identify and prioritize high\-value use cases, facilitate cross\-functional GenAI solutions tailored to diverse personas (developers, scientists, analysts), and guide build\-vs\-buy decisions to maximize scalability, effectiveness, and organizational impact.
* **Data Platforms**: Oversee the lifecycle of data platform products, including Data Movement technologies (batch and real\-time), Data Lakes, Data production and consumption patterns, quality management, enabling users to self\-service these capabilities on our Google Cloud environment
* **Team Management**: Lead, mentor, and manage a team of Product Managers, creating an integrated strategy across your products, fostering a culture of collaboration, measurement and creating space to learn and improve.
* **Stakeholder Collaboration:** Work closely with cross\-functional teams, including Engineering, Data Science, Analytics, and other key stakeholders to ensure our data platforms meet their needs and drive business value.
* **Market Analysis:** Stay abreast of industry trends and competitive landscape to inform product decisions and identify opportunities for innovation and improvement.
* **Product Metrics**: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of data platform products and drive continuous improvement.
* **Driving adoption and value realization:** Market your product internally to various departments to ensure all available users know about your product and how they could value from it
* **Communication:** Articulate product vision, strategy, and roadmap to internal and external stakeholders, ensuring transparency and alignment across the organization. Maintain a product vision and roadmap, keeping stakeholders and constituents up to date on the top level goals and timelines

  


**We Are a Match Because You Have:**


* 7\+ years of experience in product management, with at least 3 years in a leadership role overseeing data and/or AI platforms
* 5\+ years of product experience in developing data\-driven products that are cloud native
* Strong understanding of data movement technologies (batch and real\-time), Data Lakes, analytical data systems, GenAI tools and applying models to real\-world problems.
* Strong written and verbal communication and a demonstrated ability to explain technical concepts to non\-technical audiences
* Proven experience in leading and collaborating with senior stakeholders along with a multi\-quarter roadmap with iterative value delivery
* Demonstrable ability to be technically hands\-on, up to architecting high\-level system plans (no coding)
* Understanding of big data technologies, data lakes, streaming / real\-time data solutions
* Understanding of Data \& AI Infrastructure tooling/solutions and scaling on public cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
* Ability to structure problems, develop clear hypotheses, and prioritize work against the largest impact initiatives
* Experience working with multiple engineering teams, running their sprints, stand\-ups, and backlog management
* Cultivate senior presence and be the leader of your portfolio of products

  


**Why You’ll Love Wayfair:**


* Time Off:
* + Paid Holidays
	+ Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Health \& Wellness:
* + Full Health Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA)
	+ Life Insurance
	+ DIsability Protection (Short Term \& Long Term DIsability)
	+ Global Wellbeing: Gym/Fitness discounts (including US Peloton, Global ClassPass, and various regional gym memberships)
	+ Mental Health Support (Global Mental Health, Global Wayhealthy Recordings)
	+ Caregiver Services
* Financial Growth \& Security:
* + 401K Matching (Employee Matching Program)
	+ Tuition Reimbursement
	+ Financial Health Education (Knowledge of Financial Education \- KOFE)
	+ Tax Advantaged Accounts
* Family Support:
* + Family Planning Support
	+ Parental Leave
	+ Global Surrogacy \& Adoption Policy
* Professional Development \& Recognition:
* + Rewards \& Recognition
	+ Global Employee Anniversary Awards
	+ Paid Volunteer Work
* Unique Perks:
* + Employee Discount
	+ U.S. Bluebikes Membership
	+ Global Pod Outings
* Work/Life Balance:
* + Emphasizing a supportive \& flexible work environment that encourages a balance between personal and professional commitments

We are looking forward to your application!

title: Warehouse Team Lead 1
description:
***The pay for this position is $20\.50/hr***



We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!

 **Shift**


* Wednesday \- Saturday 6:45am \- 5:15pm

 **Benefits (Start Day 1!)**


* Referral bonuses
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k) with company match with company match
* Wayfair company discount
* Benefits start day one
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)

  


**What You'll Do**


* The Warehouse Team Lead will assist your supervisor with managing and overseeing all functions of the warehouse, and ensuring smooth operations of all activities
* Lead the receiving department and ensure the functions are used correctly
* Delegate and assign work to keep a 100% fill rate
* Help manage the inventory and conduct necessary training within the department
* Ensure the proper use and accountability of tools
* Ensure hours and functions are recorded correctly (e.g. Time clocks)
* Be responsible for answering email and verbal questions in a timely manner
* Keep product moving and oversee the cleanliness of the department. This includes daily trash compacting
* Additional responsibilities as assigned


**What You’ll Need**


* Working understanding of WMS system.
* Leadership and motivational skills, and the ability to make decisions with little to no guidance based on policies or common sense
* This is a floor position, and will involve physically moving/processing products in addition to leading a team of warehouse associates
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 pounds unassisted and maneuvering product 150\+ pounds unassisted or via team lift
* Experienced in more than one department. Work areas include: receiving, inventory control, pick, pack, ship and return of product
* Experience with composing and replying to emails
* Power Equipment experience – Must be able to operate or willing to be trained on Powered Industrial Truck Operations (PITO)
* Experience with creating and updating systems such as trouble tickets
* 2\+ years working experience. Must have excellent attendance
* Understanding of High Jump is a plus
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you


**Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities**  

Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. As part of this commitment, Wayfair will make reasonable accommodations to the known physical or mental limitations of qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on business operations. title: Transportation Specialist
description:
***The pay for this position is $21\.75/hr with $2/hr shift differential (if applicable)***

  


We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!



Transportation/Routing Specialists are responsible for inventory fidelity and back\-end warehouse support. Transportation Specialists ensure that POs are in their proper inventory states, leading to streamlined scheduling and delivery. Transportation Specialists are also responsible for reconciling exceptions, reverse logistics, and driver paperwork.

 **Shift**


* Mon \- Fri 11:30 AM \- 8:00 PM


**Benefits (Start Day 1!)**


* $2\.00/hr Shift differential after 6:00pm
* Referral bonuses
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k)
* Wayfair company discount
* Benefits start day one
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)


**What You'll Do**


* Use Wayfair inventory systems and tools to ensure "perfect" orders run smoothly from receipt at the terminal to dispatching for delivery
* Identify exceptions such as damage, short shipments, mis shipments, overweight/oversized cartons, etc., and reconcile these issues, engaging Customer Service and other partner teams as needed
* Inventory freight returning after a missed or refused delivery, escalating reports of missing freight to terminal leadership
* Set up schedules for outgoing freight (returns, liquidation, donation, disposal) and maintain relationships with reverse logistics carriers
* Print any necessary paperwork for delivery teams, correcting any errors
* Write and distribute an "end of shift" report to all terminal staff and any necessary partner teams
* Provide feedback on processes and tools
* Support Customer Service and other partner teams in efforts to maintain high customer satisfaction


**What You'll Need**


* 2\+ years of relevant experience in a similar role
* Ability to lift 75\+ lbs to assist the warehouse team as needed
* Strong written and verbal communication skills with a strong customer\-centric approach
* Ability to multitask and navigate through various systems and tools
* Well organized and detail oriented
* Comfort with Microsoft Office and learning new technologies
* Proactive in identifying opportunities for improvement and driving solutions
* Experienced in Logistics or Transportation
* BA/BS preferred

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
***The pay for this position is $16\.00/hr***

We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!

 **Shift**


* Wednesday \- Saturday 6:00ama \- 4:30pm


**Benefits**


* $1\.50/hr Shift Differential for hours worked between 6:00pm \- 6:00am
* Referral bonus
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k) with company match
* Wayfair company discount
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)
* Dozens of discounts and perks with partners


**What You'll Do**


* Unload and receive inbound furniture orders which will require manually moving large, heavy goods.
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 pounds unassisted and maneuvering product 150\+ pounds unassisted or via team lift.
* Use scan technology to document pertinent carton level information, including condition, quantity, and warehouse location of material.
* Proactively monitor order management systems to ensure that all orders have been received properly and that detailed descriptions are provided for any Overage/Shortage/Damage issues.
* Perform regular cycle counts to ensure inventory is accurate and up to date.
* Pick deliveries from inventory and stage them by truck and stop number.
* Provide direct input into the existing user tools and make recommendations for improvements based on your everyday experience.
* Be a vocal contributor on the team.
* Work effectively with peers and managers.
* Identify the most efficient way to complete assigned tasks and asks clarifying questions when appropriate.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.
* Be cross trained in other departments and required to perform additional responsibilities as assigned


**What You'll Need**


* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 lbs. unassisted and moving product 150\+ lbs. unassisted or via team lift.
* Must be able to work on warehouse floor 8 hours a day or more.
* Strong, consistent work ethic.
* Comfort with scanning technology.
* Experience in Distribution or Logistics is a plus.
* Experience working in High Jump is a plus.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.


**Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities**  

Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. As part of this commitment, Wayfair will make reasonable accommodations to the known physical or mental limitations of qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on business operations. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, please let us know by completing our Accomodations for Applicants form.  

  

**Need Technical Assistance?**  

For more information about applying for a career at wayfair, visit our FAQ page here.  

  

**About Wayfair Inc.**  

Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.



Your personal data is processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice (https://www.wayfair.com/careers/privacy). If you have any questions or wish to exercise your rights under applicable privacy and data protection laws, please contact us at dataprotectionofficer@wayfair.com.

title: Terminal Manager
description:
We are looking for a talented and driven Home Delivery Operations Terminal Manager to join us and lead our Norton Delivery Operations. You will lead a team of Supervisors, Associates/Specialists, and Driver Partners serving our customers in your delivery area.



We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding specialized services, and reducing damage.



Home Delivery Site Leader is a fantastic spot to start your Wayfair journey. We have ambitious plans for over the next 5 years, so opportunities for growth will be plentiful for those who want them!


**What You’ll Do**


* Assume full responsibility for the safety, customer experience, employee experience, quality, and cost of your Home Delivery Operation Terminal \- this is your site \- get excited to Be an Owner
* Provide inspirational leadership and guidance to your team of Wayfair Warehouse and Wayfair Transportation employees, inclusive of leaders and frontline staff
* Build a partnership with our Delivery Partners ensuring your operation has the needed outbound capacity and provides an exceptional home delivery customer experience
* Drive results for your building across a comprehensive and balanced set of performance metrics (e.g., Safety, Customer, Employee, Quality, Cost)
* Develop your people by relentlessly focusing on skill development and career pathing
* Collaborate with several core stakeholders and ensure your building has what it needs to be successful (e.g., Safety, Talent Mgt, Talent Acquisition, Transportation, Training, Workforce Planning, Technology, to name a few…)
* Champion change for your team \- we are always improving and we move fast


**What You'll Need**


* Ownership mentality and motivation to build the best team
* Strong leadership skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross functional teams
* Ability to proactively identify opportunities and implement solutions; lean/six sigma a plus
* Comfort with delivery routing technologies/strategies and warehouse management systems
* Comfort with raw data sets as well as creating simple but useful templates in google sheets
* BA/BS in management, administration, supply chain, or customer service.
* 5\+ years working experience in fulfillment, distribution, home delivery or transportation
* Bilingual is a plus


**Find your place in the Wayborhood! Click** **here** **to stay informed on upcoming warehouse leadership opportunities.**

Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. title: Assistant Store Manager, Retail Operations
description:
**Assistant Store Manager, Logistics \& Inventory Operations \- Wayfair Branded Stores**



Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091

  


*The salary range for this position is $57,000\-$70,000 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience.*

  


**Overview:**  

  

As an **Assistant Store Manager (ASM)**, you’ll take a leading role in bringing Wayfair’s retail vision to life within a high\-performing sales and customer centric environment. Reporting to the Department Manager, you will oversee critical store functions for teams, and assist across team verticals including operational excellence, visual merchandising and design, and team development, to ensure an exceptional customer experience, drive a high performance team, and deliver on overall business targets.



This position blends strategic leadership (approx 60%) with hands\-on execution and tactical (approx 40%) requiring a balance of creativity, business acumen, and strong leadership. You’ll leverage data\-driven insights to implement merchandising strategies, optimize store operations, and inspire your team to exceed expectations in every area—from sales to service. Your contributions will directly impact the store’s success by fostering a collaborative, customer\-focused culture that reflects the brand’s values.



The ideal candidate thrives in leading large teams, in a fast\-paced and dynamic environment. They should be excited to excel while balancing priorities, and have a proven track record of coaching, mentoring, and developing talent to achieve results. Join Wayfair to help lead, innovate, and shape the in\-store experience as we redefine the definition of retail excellence.

  


**What Does an Assistant Store Manager (ASM) Do?**

  

* **Adapt Under Pressure:** Excel in managing competing priorities, navigating high\-pressure situations with poise and efficiency, and ensuring seamless store operations and team productivity.
* **Demonstrate Operational Versatility:** Demonstrate expertise in overseeing store functions, including sales performance, asset protection, safety compliance, and customer engagement, from opening through closing of daily store operations. Serve as a keyholder to help open or close the store as needed.
* **Execute Sales\-Driven Leadership:** Leverage a deep understanding of proactive sales environments and proven tactics to strategically inspire, motivate, and lead teams to exceed performance goals and deliver exceptional results.
* **Coach and Develop Teams:** You’ll embody strong leadership and professional maturity while providing actionable feedback and guidance across all teams to drive strong business results and foster associate growth. This will also include accountability conversations and coaching in\-the\-moment to ensure all team members meet expectations and demonstrate the Wayfair People Principles at all times.
* **Lead a First\-in\-Class Experience:** Represent a deep understanding of Wayfair’s customer\-first commitment through product knowledge to assist customers, collaborate with all teams, and deliver an authentic, friendly, and memorable shopping experience.
* **Possess Organizational Proficiency:** Show high proficiency in organization, planning, communication, and relationship management abilities, with a talent for appropriately organizing in\-store teams to execute against priorities.
* **Analytical Thinking:** Ability to interpret sales trends, evaluate data, and implement strategies to drive business growth and strategically problem solve.
* **Embrace Innovation:** Bring energy and creativity to the role by sharing ideas to improve operations within our operating guardrails to help enhance brand recognition, product presentation, and adapt to a fast\-paced environment with evolving selection, promotions, and competing priorities.

  


**What are the Specific Responsibilities of a Logistics ASM?**

  

* **Inventory Accuracy**: Maintain accurate tracking and organization of inventory across the sales floor and back of house, ensuring optimal stock levels and operational efficiency. You will also coordinate your teams to oversee furniture assembly.
* **Price and Audit Management**: Verify product pricing accuracy and conduct regular audits to identify and address discrepancies, ensuring compliance and consistency.
* **Inbound and Receiving Operations**: Oversee incoming shipments, including product quality and quantity verification, accurate inventory counts, and timely stock integration.
* **Returns and Exception Management**: Manage the returns process, addressing inventory discrepancies and ensuring proper documentation, restocking, or disposal of items as needed.
* **Picking and Fulfillment Coordination**: Supervise the picking and preparation of items for the sales floor, minimizing errors and ensuring timely replenishment.
* **Outbound and Reverse Logistics**: Coordinate the efficient dispatch of goods and returns to meet Wayfair Global Supply Chain standards.
* **Utilize Technological Competency:** Quickly learn software, technology, or new platforms effectively, including mobile apps, portable devices, Google Workspace, and/or intraoffice communication tools.

  


**What are the Job Requirements?**

  

* 1\+ year of previous experience leading a team (10\-30\+ individuals)
* 2\+ years of previous leadership experience motivating a team of high performers to achieve strong business results through Visual Merchandising and Brand Presentation (such as a store leader, manager, or trainer.)
* 3\+ years of prior retail experience (preference for home, furnishing, and interior design spaces.)
* You will be required to work a flexible schedule that may include nights, weekends, and holidays.

  


**Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements**:

  

* Physical Demands
* + Frequent movement including standing, stooping, kneeling, crouching
	+ Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
	+ Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
	+ Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
	+ Ability to ascend/descend stairs, ladders, and balance
	
	Ability to use a variety of hand\-held tools (such as, but not limited to, wire cutter, wire strippers, screwdrivers, hammer, measuring tape, leveler, drill).  
	+
* Working Environment
* + Some exposure to cold, heat, and humidity
	+ Occasional noise and vibrations
	+ Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes

  



  

**What are the Benefits\*?**

  

* Competitive pay
* Bonus eligibility
* Career development opportunities
* Health, vision, \& dental insurance coverages (start on day one)
* Paid time off (start accruing time immediately)
* 401(k) with company match (up to 4%)
* Eligible tuition reimbursement (after 6 months of employment)
* Wayfair Employee discount
* Discount at instore dining cafe
* Paid / unpaid parental leave options
* Regular upskilling and trainings for your continued development


Career advancement opportunities and much more!  

* *Full Benefits as outlined above are based on full\-time employment status, these may vary or change for part\-time or seasonal status employees. Detailed benefit guides will be issued to anyone who is offered a position with Wayfair for further insights into all of the great offerings available. If you’re curious to learn more about a specific benefit detail, your recruiter or a member of our team onsite can help with this information!*
 **About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.



Your personal data is processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice (https://www.wayfair.com/careers/privacy). If you have any questions or wish to exercise your rights under applicable privacy and data protection laws, please contact us at dataprotectionofficer@wayfair.com.

title: Part Time Associate, Visual Merchandising
description:
**Visual Merchandising Associate (Part Time)**



Location: 3232 Lake Ave. STE 1, Wilmette, IL 60091



The pay rate for this position is $17\.00 per hour.


#### **Overview:**



As a **Visual Merchandising Associate**, you’ll play an essential role in executing in\-store visual initiatives, ensuring that every presentation reflects Wayfair’s seasonal strategies and brand standards. You’ll focus on maintaining floor sets, signage, and overall store presentation while supporting daily operations that bring the Wayfair brand to life. This role requires attention to detail, adaptability, and a passion for creating an inspiring shopping experience. Reporting to the Visual Merchandising Manager, you’ll contribute to the foundation of visual merchandising for Wayfair’s growing retail presence.


**What Does a Visual Merchandising Associate Do?**


* **Execute Visual Standards:** Support floorset execution, product replenishment, signage placement, and visual maintenance, including folding and steaming textiles, bed\-making, and basic cleanliness tasks.
* **Ensure Presentation Excellence:** Maintain and update store displays to align with visual directives, making adjustments as needed to uphold brand standards.
* **Support Merchandise Flow:** Assist in replenishing products to maintain inventory levels and ensure a seamless shopping experience.
* **Utilize Technology:** Operate company\-provided tools to execute visual merchandising tasks and store operations effectively.
* **Engage Customers:** Provide a welcoming and friendly experience, offering helpful information and guidance while supporting sales engagement and transactions.
* **Adapt and Collaborate:** Work closely with store leaders and teammates across all departments to meet evolving business needs while maintaining a visually compelling store environment.
* **Receive and Apply Feedback:** Embrace coaching and direction from store leaders to ensure all visual merchandising aligns with Wayfair’s brand vision.
* **Thrive in a Fast\-Paced Environment:** Execute tasks efficiently in a dynamic setting with frequent product, promotion, and operational updates.


**What are the Job Requirements?**


* **Retail Visual Experience:** 1–3 years of experience in a retail setting with a focus on maintaining presentations and resetting departments (required).
* **Customer\-Facing Experience:** 1–3 years of experience providing customer service in a retail setting (preferred).
* **Technical Skills:** Comfortable using visual merchandising tools and store technology, with a willingness to learn new systems.
* **Flexibility:** Ability to work a varied schedule, including nights, weekends, and some holidays, based on business needs.
* **Attention to Detail:** Strong organizational and multitasking skills, with the ability to execute visual merchandising tasks with accuracy and efficiency.
* **Adaptability \& Professionalism:** Ability to work in a fast\-paced environment while maintaining a professional and customer\-focused approach.


**Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements**:


* Physical Demands
* + Frequent movement including standing, stooping, kneeling, crouching
	+ Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
	+ Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
	+ Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
	+ Ability to ascend/descend stairs and balance
* Working Environment
* + Some exposure to cold, heat, and humidity
	+ Occasional noise and vibrations
	+ Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes

**What are the Benefits\*?**


* **Competitive Pay:** Earn competitive compensation with regular opportunities for performance\-based increases.
* **Career Growth:** Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
* **Health Benefits from Day One:** Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
* **Time to Recharge:** Start accruing paid time off immediately—because work\-life balance matters.
* **401(k) with Company Match:** We’ll match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
* **Tuition Reimbursement:** Eligible after 6 months of employment—learn, grow, and get support along the way.
* **Wayfair Employee Discount:** Save big on the pieces you love—plus get 10% off at our in\-store restaurant ️.
* **Parental Leave Options:** Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.


✨ **And So Much More:** We’ve got more good stuff where that came from! NOTE: our full\-time roles receive the full benefits package above, while part\-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in\-store team can help with any questions!

 **About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.



Your personal data is processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice (https://www.wayfair.com/careers/privacy). If you have any questions or wish to exercise your rights under applicable privacy and data protection laws, please contact us at dataprotectionofficer@wayfair.com.

* You will be required to work a flexible schedule that may include nights, weekends, and holidays.

  


**Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements**:

  

* Physical Demands
* + Frequent movement including standing, stooping, kneeling, crouching
	+ Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
	+ Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
	+ Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
	+ Ability to ascend/descend stairs, ladders, and balance
	
	Ability to use a variety of hand\-held tools (such as, but not limited to, wire cutter, wire strippers, screwdrivers, hammer, measuring tape, leveler, drill).  
	+
* Working Environment
* + Some exposure to cold, heat, and humidity
	+ Occasional noise and vibrations
	+ Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes

  



  

**What are the Benefits\*?**

  

* Competitive pay
* Bonus eligibility
