title: Executive Assistant
description:
*This position is a hybrid in\-office role that works out of our Boston HQ. Monday\-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.*



Wayfair, one of the largest retailers of home furnishings and housewares in the United States, has an immediate need for an Executive Assistant to manage the day\-to\-day activities for leaders across our Marketing and Specialty Retail Brand teams. This is a fantastic opportunity for the right individual to support the senior leaders of one of the fastest\-growing companies in Boston. The ideal candidate will have strong organizational and planning skills, a sense of urgency, be detail oriented, and have problem\-solving abilities. This person should be smart, engaging, fun, curious, and unflappable.



Wayfair’s team of Executive Assistants play a crucial role in supporting executives. Their responsibilities include scheduling and coordinating meetings, managing travel arrangements, and opportunities to own projects across different operational functions. This position offers a unique opportunity for an experienced executive assistant looking to elevate their career.


**What You’ll Do:**


* Executive Support: Provide support for 3\-6 leaders in Marketing and Specialty Retail Brands. Enhance the executives' efficiency and effectiveness through comprehensive support.
* Calendar Management: Organize and manage all aspects of internal and external meetings with the ability to schedule and prioritize meetings, resolve schedule conflicts, collaborate with other team members, and stay several steps ahead to maintain efficiency.
* Travel Management: Arrange all travel details, both domestic and international, with the ability to make frequent revisions as necessary.
* Expense Management: Handle monthly business expense reports, ensuring timely and accurate processing.
* Event Planning: Support with planning, coordination and execution of team events.
* Customer Focus: Maintain a customer\-centric approach, ask pertinent questions in meetings, and readily adapt to new challenges.
* Teamwork and Positivity: Foster a collaborative team environment, keep a positive attitude, and proactively support colleagues and company events.
* Admin Coverage: Provide coverage for members of the leadership support team as needed.
* Thrive in a fast\-paced workplace by effectively multitasking and managing competing priorities.


**What You’ll Need:**


* At least 2\+ years of experience as Administrative Assistant/Executive Assistant for senior level executives.
* Ability to be assertive and give push\-back as needed.
* Meticulous attention to detail and strong planning and forward\-thinking capabilities.
* Flexible and be able to adapt quickly to last\-minute changes, taking them in stride while maintaining a pleasant manner and motivating spirit.
* Demonstrated ability to anticipate needs and situations before they are fully developed.
* Advanced proficiency in Google Enterprise Suite tools (calendar, mail drive, docs, sheets, slides, meet).
* Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills.
* Extremely high level of discretion pertaining to confidential information.


**Massachusetts Applicants:** I understand that it is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.


*At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for employment authorization for this position for the following work visas: STEM OPT EAD, H\-1B, H\-1B1, E\-3, O\-1, J\-1, or TN.*

title: Wayfair Outlet Seasonal Receiving Associate (Part Time)
description:
**Wayfair Outlet Seasonal Retail Receiving Associate**
======================================================

  



Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring a Seasonal Retail Receiving Associate for our returns Outlet retail store in **Orlando, FL**! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, Wayfair’s Outlet store might be the future home for your career. **Starting Rate: $16 per hour** **Hours**: 20 hours per week (Morning shifts are required)
***Store hours:***

Monday \-Saturday: 10am \-8pm

Sunday: 11AM\-7PM  

**Benefits to building a HOME for your career with Wayfair:**

* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)
* Wayfair company discount
* Referral bonuses
  


**What you’ll do:**
* As an authentic brand ambassador for the Wayfair family, lead and create a best in class customer experience by connecting them with the world's biggest and best home online assortment brought to life in our stores.
* Manage and monitor stock levels, merchandise adjacencies, presentations, signing, and assortment in all departments to ensure the sales\-floor is adequately stocked. Maintain visual standards required by Wayfair and Tanger Outlets.
* Support customer fulfillment across all channels leveraging all services including (order pick up, incoming inventory).
* Maintaining visual standards, replenishment, safety and backroom standards.
* Participate in all operational aspects of the store including but not limited to: processing new products, floor sets, replenishment, substitutions and general upkeep of the store
* Exemplify a positive and professional attitude on a daily basis with customers and your team members.
* Bring a willingness to share innovative ideas and solutions to continuously improve team operations.
* Engage in a high energy, focused and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions, offerings and operations.
* Assist with furniture delivery to customer's vehicles

  


**Criteria:**
* 1\+ years of stock receiving required, retail and/or customer service experience preferred
* Positive attitude and passion for great customer service
* Strong organization, self\-motivation, communication and relationship management skills.
* Demonstrated ability to work within a team environment.
* Proficiency in Google and Microsoft Office applications preferred.
* All employees will be expected to represent the brand through polished communication, personal appearance and professionalism.

  


**Essential Functions:**
* Excellent verbal communication skills.
* Excellent active listening skills.
* Positive, professional attitude and demonstrated enthusiasm for supporting customers
* Technical acumen to learn necessary software (google and microsoft office) to manage inventory and price items
* Ability to process information and merchandise through a computer system and POS register system.

  


**Physical Requirements:**
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. **Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 pounds unassisted and maneuvering product 150\+ pounds unassisted or via team lift**.
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

  


**Working Hours:**

At Wayfair and our family of brands, we strive to provide our employees with a work schedule that protects their work/life balance and takes their scheduling preferences into consideration. Please understand due to the nature of the retail industry, your shift schedule will vary. However, we will work to provide you with your schedule a minimum of 2 weeks in advance, and you will have the opportunity to trade with teammates as needed.

Our store hours are Monday \- Saturday: 10am \- 8pm \& Sunday 11am \- 7pm. Employee shifts may include two hours before or after store hours.

  

Employment/promotion to this role will be contingent on successful completion of a background check. **Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities**  

Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. As part of this commitment, Wayfair will make reasonable accommodations to the known physical or mental limitations of qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on business operations. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, please let us know by completing our Accomodations for Applicants form.  

  

**Need Technical Assistance?**  

For more information about applying for a career at wayfair, visit our FAQ page here.

Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. title: Sr. Marketing Cross Channel Analyst
description:
*This position is a hybrid in\-office role that works out of our Boston HQ. Monday\-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.*


* **At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.**



The Sr. cross channel analyst is a marketing generalist who supports the CMO function for Wayfair Canada, specifically to drive performance marketing success. This person is the resident expert on marketing channel performance for the brands, steers the marketing strategic planning process (i.e., forecasting and roadmap collaboration), and leads the thinking on multi\-channel marketing strategies (e.g, targeting) that improve channel effectiveness and customers health.


**What You’ll Do:**


* Marketing Performance: Own the marketing performance narrative in all formal and informal touchpoints. Execute deep\-dive investigations that span across channels (in partnership with marketing channel teams) to deliver actionable insights to department leadership. Own all formal reporting.
* Channel Effectiveness: Deep understanding of full marketing funnel to serve as strategic thought partner to marketing channel teams. Hold individual channels accountable for test rigor and business results. Draw connections across channel roadmaps (e.g., between prospecting \& email) to improve overall customer experience to amplify channel\-specific performance. Promote a balanced focus on operational excellence.
* Strategic Planning: Drive the ad spend forecasting process with the channel leads to ladder up into the broader quarterly P\&L process, in partnership with Brand Finance. Intra\-quarter, lead the monitoring and management of performance metrics against the forecast.
* Strategic Projects: Support investigation into cross\-channel levers (e.g., personalization, targeting, retargeting) to improve customer growth / customer health. Serve as a project manager for complex multi\-channel projects, ensuring scalability / sustainability of initiatives, knowledge\-sharing and impactful results.


**What You Need:**


* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Analytics, or related fields.
* 3\+ years of experience in a performance marketing role.
* Strong analytical skills with experience using tools such as SQL and Looker.
* Experience developing roadmaps and informing marketing strategies.
* Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously .
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to tailor updates to the appropriate audience (senior stakeholders, peers, analysts, etc.).
* An entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to thrive in a highly ambiguous and fast\-paced environment with a dynamic bias for action.


**Massachusetts Applicants:** I understand that it is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

title: Senior Marketing Analyst
description:
*This position is a hybrid in\-office role that works out of our Boston HQ. Monday\-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.*


* **At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.**



The Sr. cross channel analyst is a marketing generalist who supports the CMO function for Wayfair Canada, specifically to drive performance marketing success. This person is the resident expert on marketing channel performance for the brands, steers the marketing strategic planning process (i.e., forecasting and roadmap collaboration), and leads the thinking on multi\-channel marketing strategies (e.g, targeting) that improve channel effectiveness and customers health.


**What You’ll Do:**


* Marketing Performance: Own the marketing performance narrative in all formal and informal touchpoints. Execute deep\-dive investigations that span across channels (in partnership with marketing channel teams) to deliver actionable insights to department leadership. Own all formal reporting.
* Channel Effectiveness: Deep understanding of full marketing funnel to serve as strategic thought partner to marketing channel teams. Hold individual channels accountable for test rigor and business results. Draw connections across channel roadmaps (e.g., between prospecting \& email) to improve overall customer experience to amplify channel\-specific performance. Promote a balanced focus on operational excellence.
* Strategic Planning: Drive the ad spend forecasting process with the channel leads to ladder up into the broader quarterly P\&L process, in partnership with Brand Finance. Intra\-quarter, lead the monitoring and management of performance metrics against the forecast.
* Strategic Projects: Support investigation into cross\-channel levers (e.g., personalization, targeting, retargeting) to improve customer growth / customer health. Serve as a project manager for complex multi\-channel projects, ensuring scalability / sustainability of initiatives, knowledge\-sharing and impactful results.


**What You Need:**


* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Analytics, or related fields.
* 3\+ years of experience in a performance marketing role.
* Strong analytical skills with experience using tools such as SQL and Looker.
* Experience developing roadmaps and informing marketing strategies.
* Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously .
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to tailor updates to the appropriate audience (senior stakeholders, peers, analysts, etc.).
* An entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to thrive in a highly ambiguous and fast\-paced environment with a dynamic bias for action.


**Massachusetts Applicants:** I understand that it is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

title: Furniture Repair Tech III
description:
***The pay for this position starts at $37\.82/hr***  

  



We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!

 **Shift**
* Sun \- Wed 6 AM \- 4:30 PM

 **Wayfair Benefits**
* $1\.50 Shift differential after 6:00pm
* Referral bonuses
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k)
* Wayfair company discount
* Benefits start day one
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)

 **What You'll Do**
* Work independentlyto evaluate damages and defects of items and determine if items can be repaired. Make any required adjustments to items ahead of delivery and ensure item is in perfect condition to be delivered to the customer
* Prioritize and execute on daily, weekly, and monthly tasks (repairs) to ensure completion in a effective and timely manner
* Accurately reports outcomes of work in progress, completed, \& past due work
* Monitors inventory, and orders replacement parts and complete installs as needed
* Ask clarifying questions when appropriate
* Administer appropriate repair methods for various product types including, but not limited to:
* + Evaluate each piece of furniture to determine the type of wood and/or upholstery repairs, parts, and materials needed to complete the job
	+ Case Goods: Burn\-ins, refinishing, joinery, match colors, and simulate wood grain
	+ Refinishes and patches damaged furniture including paint, stain, enamel or lacquers; mixes paints and stains to match existing finish
	+ Repairs, replaces and rebuilds damaged wood, leather or upholstery furniture or mechanical parts
	+ Operates tools such as power drills, sanders, saws, and other tools required for repair
* Use scan technology to document pertinent carton level information, including condition, quantity, warehouse location and detail repair completed
* Provide direct input into the existing user tools and make recommendations for improvements based on expertise \& experience
* Be a vocal contributor on the team
* Contribute to the building and development of training materials for applicable functions
* Must understand that this role will require you to work cooperatively with others, adjust to change, be a reliable team member, and work with other towards a common goal

 **What You'll Need**
* At least 5\+ years prior experience in furniture repair/construction
* Advanced understanding of repairing wood items including: color and stain matching, damage/defect repair
* Ability to use power and hand tools as needed
* Advanced understanding of repairing upholstery and multiple fabric types a plus
* High attention to detail and prioritizes quality to deliver a perfect item to the customer.
* Must be comfortable lifting up to 75 lbs. unassisted and moving product 150\+ lbs. unassisted or via team lift
* Must be able to work on warehouse floor 8 hours a day or more
* Strong, consistent work ethic and ability to manage time effectively
* Comfort with scanning technology.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.
* Must be at least 18 years of age.
* Certification in Furniture Repair/Restoration, preferred

The safety of employees remains our \#1 priority and is at the heart of every decision made. We have taken a variety of steps to ensure that Wayfair is one of the safest places to work by:
* Providing Guidelines to help employees maintain proper social distancing
* Providing and requiring suitable PPE such as masks, gloves, and safety vests.
* Increased sanitizing stations, as well as, improved professional sanitization of each facility.
* Team stretches at the start of each shift \- if you've come to flex your muscles, you first have to stretch them!

title: Full-Time Visual Merchandising Associate - Perigold Luxury
description:
**Associate, Visual Merchandising**



Location: West Palm Beach, FL


**Brief Overview of Position**



Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores, first\-of\-their\-kind luxury retail destinations of 20\-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories. Come be a part of it! We are looking for a Visual Merchandising Associate who will be responsible for the daily maintenance of all in\-store Visual Merchandising initiatives (e.g. Presentation, Marketing/Signage, Merchandise Flow, Visual Operations) as we bring the in\-store experience for the Perigold brand to life. We are seeking an individual with strong organizational, multitasking and time\-management skills with great attention to detail while ensuring in\-store presentations align with the seasonal strategy for the Perigold organization. This position will play a significant role in helping build and shape the internal Visual Merchandising team structure and execution of processes for all future Perigold stores. This position will report directly to the Visual Merchandising Senior Associate.


**What you’ll do**


* Maintain luxury experience standards by supporting an authentic, inviting guest experience that exemplifies our commitment to customer satisfaction and passion for luxury design.
* Assist with Visual Merchandising tasks such as floorsets, product replenishment, signage/marketing and maintaining company visual standards (including folding \& steaming textiles, bed making and basic cleanliness tasks as needed).
* Ensure store presentations are as close to the directive as possible.
* Use of company provided technology related to Visual Merchandising and Store Operations.
* Be open to receiving feedback and direction from store leaders around brand presentation to deliver Wayfair standards on a daily basis.
* Assist all customers in store by providing helpful information, guidance, and support in sales transactions.
* Assist with replenishment efforts in store to address store instocks.


**What you’ll need**


*Experience*


* 1\-3 years Visual retail experience, specific to maintaining presentations and resetting departments. Required
* 1\-3 years Customer experience in a retail setting. Preferred
* Demonstrated experience or interest in luxury a plus.


*Skills and Abilities*


* Highly skilled in understanding of how to use technology and a willingness to learn new programs. (High Proficiency)
* Ability to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends and some holidays. (High Proficiency)
* Capable of thriving in a fast\-paced environment while demonstrating professional maturity. (Medium Proficiency)
* Candidates must be open to learning how to safely operate a pallet jack (also known as a pallet truck or pump truck) as part of their job responsibilities. Training will be provided to ensure proper handling and safety protocols are followed. Typically, this requires you to be able to lift at least 50lbs or more.


*Physical Demands*


* Stationary Position \- Constantly
* Move/Traverse \- Constantly
* Stationary Position/Seated \- Rarely
* Transport/Lifting \- Occasionally
* Transport/Carrying \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Exerting Force/Pushing \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Exerting Force/Pulling \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Ascend/Descend \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Balancing \- Occasionally
* Position Self/Stooping \- Frequently
* Position Self/Kneeling \- Frequently
* Position Self/Crouching \- Frequently
* Position Self/Crawling \- Occasionally
* Reaching \- Constantly
* Handling \- Constantly
* Grasping \- Constantly
* Feeling \- Constantly
* Communicate/Talking \- Constantly
* Communicate/Hearing \- Constantly
* Repetitive Motions \- Frequently
* Coordination \- Frequently


**Compensation \& Benefits:**


* Compensation starting at $24\.00 per hour \+ substantial quarterly bonuses
* Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount


**About Perigold**



Perigold is the destination for luxury home. Established in 2017, Perigold offers an unmatched selection of the world’s best design brands, with unique pieces for every style and space. The brand offers the highest quality pieces for home, backed by a quality guarantee and expert concierge support. They also offer free white\-glove delivery and 30\-day returns on most items. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Perigold is part of the Wayfair Inc. (NYSE:W) brand portfolio.

title: Senior Designer Consultant, Full Time - Perigold Luxury
description:
**Retail Design Consultant \- West Palm Beach, FL**



Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores, first\-of\-their\-kind luxury retail destinations of 20\-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories. Come be a part of it! We are



hiring experienced Designers who will be responsible for working with both Trade and Consumer clients. If you are passionate about design, looking for rapid growth, and thrive on learning and dynamic challenges, this store might be the future home for your career.

  


**What you’ll do**


* Maintain luxury experience standards and provide an authentic, inviting guest experience that exemplifies our commitment to customer satisfaction and passion for luxury design.
* Own your book of business end\-to\-end, fostering long\-standing relationships with design clients and prospecting potential new design customers in the store and in the community.
* Meet the complex needs of the Perigold customer, including large\-scale luxury projects, trade projects, and intricate custom product development
* Leverage your interior design and sales expertise in the home furnishings space to help our customers navigate through their design needs and purchases.
* Share your expertise in fabric and finishes, bringing awareness to performance, texture and durability characteristics as well as market trends using digital and physical swatches
* Manage virtual, in\-home, and in\-store design appointments (including preparation of design deliverables, product curation, and follow up).
* Utilize sales analytics and design software tools and applications to drive store profitability and growth in a way that supports the success of the overall brand (moodboards, space plans, 2d/3d room views).
* Efficiently manage your time in design appointments and sales floor interactions by prioritizing the customer experience while keeping communication open with leadership.
* Meet or exceed sales and customer satisfaction targets, and other established KPIs.
* Participate in operational store activities as needed: bringing new products to the floor, floor sets, replenishment and substitutions.
* Bring a willingness to share innovative ideas and solutions to continuously improve team operations
* Engage in a high energy, focused and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions, offerings and operations

  


**What you’ll need**


*Experience \& Qualifications*


* 2\+ years of design experience within a design firm or high end furniture retailer.
* Professional portfolio required.
* Familiarity with Perigold supplier brands, materials and construction, and custom programs a plus.
* Proven track record of managing large\-scale projects for luxury B2C and trade customers.
* Passion for design, great customer service and a drive to exceed sales targets.
* Strong organization, self\-motivation, communication and relationship management skills.
* Technical acumen to learn necessary software; proficiency in Google Suites and/or Microsoft Office applications preferred.
* Experience leveraging CRMs/POS/ and design software such as Salesforce, DesignFiles, AutoCAD, Sketchup, Revit, etc. preferred
* Demonstrated ability to work within a team sales environment.

* Flexibility availability (including mornings, nights, weekends, some holidays).


*Physical Demands*


* A valid driver's license is required for in home design visits.
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

  


**Compensation \& Benefits**


* Compensation for this role is a base of $28\.00 per hour \+ substantial quarterly bonuses based on sales achieved and successful prospecting.
* Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount.

  


**About Perigold**



Perigold is the destination for luxury home. Established in 2017, Perigold offers an unmatched selection of the world’s best design brands, with unique pieces for every style and space. The brand offers the highest quality pieces for home, backed by a quality guarantee and expert concierge support. They also offer free white\-glove delivery and 30\-day returns on most items. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Perigold is part of the Wayfair Inc. (NYSE:W) brand portfolio.

title: Product Manager, Driveway and Fleet Insights
description:
**Who We Are \[****Driveway and Fleet Insights****]**



Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our product team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with engineering, UX design, analytics, and business partners across Wayfair, our product team ensures that we’re building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways. We have a modern tech stack including sophisticated capabilities around AI, data science, multivariate testing, and personalization. We’re a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety, and intentional career development.



The Driveway and Fleet Insights team is responsible for the Wayfair Delivery Network Driveway app (Android) and visibility tool. The Product Manager in this role would work to build friction\-free driver and dispatcher applications that facilitate the movement of goods across the Wayfair global network and enable visibility into every step of the driver journey. This role and the associated products help to uncover opportunities for the surrounding Wayfair ecosystem (e.g. Routing, Customer Notification, Special instructions) in order to address gaps/defects which enhance the customer delivery experience.


**What You’ll Do**


* Areas of responsibility include solutioning in the Order Processing and Order Lifecycle Management spaces in order to support Wayfair’s growth and partner strategies in the e\-commerce space.
* Responsible for managing cross domain projects from discovery to delivery.
* Manage and create technical API data contracts to support the, defining how users should interact with the platform
* Ensure we are building a reliable, scalable, and extensible platform that supports the post order customer shopping experience
* Partner with business stakeholders to understand their businesses and co\-develop impactful solutions that drive key business value.
* Communicate and promote the product vision and progress throughout Wayfair including senior partners.


**What You’ll Need**


* 4 \+ years building software products at scale from concept to launch and beyond.
* Strong technical background with a passion for breaking down challenging problems and drive value incrementally
* Sufficient industry literacy to participate in making key choices as well as effectively communicate with technical partners such as engineering.
* Excellent analytical skills with demonstrated experience turning data into actionable insights. Some SQL experience preferred
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills at the senior leadership level, as well as with cross\-functional teams
* Deep understanding of how API\-focused products support business strategy and metrics
* Highly entrepreneurial mindset, with a bias for action \& customer\-focused innovation
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience is preferred.

  


**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. title: Operations Business Associate - Early Careers (Summer 2025 Start)
description:
**Additional Details:**


* This is a Boston based opportunity with a 4 day in office expectation (Monday \- Thursday) with 1 day remote (Friday).
* At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for employment authorization for this position for the following work visas: STEM OPT EAD, H\-1B, H\-1B1, E\-3, O\-1, J\-1, or TN


*Wayfair is continuing to expand our commitment to hiring and supporting talent early in their careers, focusing on filling opportunities with experienced graduates who have 1\-3 years of experience.*


**NA Head Supplier Desk**



“The Desk” drives critical components of Wayfair’s supplier support strategy \- our team members serve as the external ambassadors who support the supplier\-partners that feed Wayfair’s vast assortment, and leverage internal partners to execute our strategic vision of offering best\-in\-class support to an ever\-growing supplier base. We are a positive, energetic, and diverse team that enjoys working directly with suppliers to provide best\-in\-class service and create a more seamless experience when they work with our commercial platform and tools.



As an Associate on the Desk, you will work at the core of E\-commerce: operating at the intersection between customers, suppliers, and technology! More specifically, in this role, you’ll manage a team of associates, engage with suppliers, and push aspects of our strategic agenda with cross\-functional partners. You will be expected to lead initiatives that enable us to achieve our vision and produce measurable outcomes, problem\-solve with business stakeholders and tech partners alike, articulate and execute against tactical plans, and monitor service metrics.


**Supplier Service Specialist**



Wayfair is seeking collaborative, innovative, and adaptable candidates for a full\-time position as a Supplier Service Specialist within our Operations team. Operations Associates will have the opportunity to gain experience in core functional areas at the center of our logistics and supply chain functions and contribute directly to the growth and success of the company. This is an ideal opportunity for candidates who are looking to join a highly collaborative, cross\-functional team, driving forward the future of retail supply chain operations.


**What you’ll do:**



At a high level, the Supplier Service Specialists will work closely with operations and finance teams to ensure that complex or escalated supplier issues are resolved effectively and in a timely manner. This role will require cross\-functional stakeholder management, innovation, and the ability to use a problem solving framework. Tasks will include, but are not limited to:


* Manage supplier service issues that are escalated to you by frontline agents. Escalated issues cover a variety of topics including operational status updates, exception requests, and invoice disputes.
* Build expertise in CGF’s operations and support functions over time (Ocean Operations, Drayage Operations, Accounts Receivable, Billing \& Reconciliation, Product Team, etc).
* Provide feedback to our inbound ticket triage team to increase resolution on the first touch.
* Establish a feedback loop to relevant operations and support functions teams to drive an improved customer experience for CGF suppliers.
* Identify opportunities to improve or automate processes with ticket trends, and work with cross\-functional teams to implement those improvements.
* Work with Account Management teams to identify opportunities for future business and upsell opportunities.


**What You’ll Need**



Basic Qualifications:


* 1\-3 years of transferable experience in a corporate environment, including internship and co\-op experience.
* Authorization to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.


Preferred Qualifications:


* Experience in freight forwarding, operations management, logistics, supply chain, or B2B customer service.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, along with the ability to influence others.
* Analytical mindset able to process large volumes of data using a variety of reporting tools (Excel, Google Sheets, SQL, Jira, etc.).
* Ability to distill complex information in a simplistic way via emails, charts, graphs, and other forms of presentations.
* Passionate about execution with strong interest to drive customer engagement.
* Desire to own projects from beginning to end, and thrive as part of a team as well as individually.
* Comfortability navigating a fast\-paced, dynamic environment with little structure.
* Experience working with, analyzing, synthesizing, and presenting data with clarity and recommended actions.
* Strong project management and prioritization skills.

  


**Why You’ll Love Wayfair:**


* Time Off:
* + Paid Holidays
	+ Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Health \& Wellness:
* + Full Health Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA)
	+ Life Insurance
	+ Disability Protection (Short Term \& Long Term Disability)
	+ Global Wellbeing: Gym/Fitness discounts (including US Peloton, Global ClassPass, and various regional gym memberships)
	+ Mental Health Support (Global Mental Health, Global Wayhealthy Recordings)
	+ Caregiver Services
* Financial Growth \& Security:
* + 401K Matching (Employee Matching Program)
	+ Tuition Reimbursement
	+ Financial Health Education (Knowledge of Financial Education \- KOFE)
	+ Tax Advantaged Accounts
* Family Support:
* + Family Planning Support
	+ Parental Leave
	+ Global Surrogacy \& Adoption Policy
* Professional Development \& Recognition:
* + Rewards \& Recognition
	+ Global Employee Anniversary Awards
	+ Paid Volunteer Work
* Unique Perks:
* + Employee Discount
	+ U.S. Bluebikes Membership
	+ Global Pod Outings
* Work/Life Balance:
* + Emphasizing a supportive \& flexible work environment that encourages a balance between personal and professional commitments

  




**Purpose \& Inclusion at Wayfair:**  

At Wayfair, we pride ourselves on fostering an environment where every individual experiences a fair and equitable employee journey. We are committed to developing targeted resources that raise awareness around inclusion and eliminate barriers, ensuring Wayfair provides a fair and inclusive workplace experience for everyone.


**Social Impact \& Responsibility:**  

At Wayfair, we focus on helping people on their journey to home \- specifically those who have lost their way from home. We do this by leveraging our best assets, such as collaborating with leading nonprofit organizations, coordinating in\-kind product donations, empowering our employees to get involved through paid volunteer time off programs, and encouraging our customers to donate. This multi\-faceted approach allows us to support communities in need in authentic ways that align with Wayfair's broader mission of helping everyone, anywhere create their sense of home.


**Wayfair's In\-Office Policy:**



All Boston\-based corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, and work remotely the other 1 day of the week.


**Massachusetts Applicants:** I understand that it is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.


**Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities**



Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. As part of this commitment, Wayfair will make reasonable accommodations to the known physical or mental limitations of qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on business operations. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

For more information about applying for a career at Wayfair, visit our FAQ page here.

title: Full-Time Product Specialist - Perigold Luxury
description:
**Brief Overview of Position**



Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores, first\-of\-their\-kind luxury retail destinations of 20\-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories. Come be a part of it! We are looking for motivated individuals to join our sales team who are passionate about luxury and/or design, relentlessly focused on boosting sales, building personalized connections, and creating an environment that invites and inspires our guests.

  


**What you’ll do**


* Maintain luxury experience standards by providing an authentic, inviting guest experience that exemplifies our commitment to customer satisfaction and passion for luxury design.
* Drive sales in store by building personalized connections with customers through thoughtful questions to understand their needs..
* Become an expert on Perigold products and services to help guide guests thru their questions and provide product options both in store and online thru our endless aisle and store application.
* Demonstrate confidence in closing the sale and educating guests on various ways to purchase including through POS, Online, and our app.
* Collaborate with Design team, generating and referring leads as appropriate or supporting product inquiries coming from the design process.
* Contribute effectively as needed in all operational aspects of the store including but not limited to: processing new products, floor sets, replenishment, backfill substitutions, and general upkeep of the store.
* Exemplify a positive and professional attitude on a daily basis with customers and team members.
* Bring a willingness to share innovative ideas and solutions to continuously improve team operations.
* Engage in a high energy, focused and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions, and operations.

  


**What you’ll need**


*Experience*


* Retail sales experience (Design related environment and/or luxury sales experience a plus)
* Flexibility availability (including mornings, nights, weekends, some holidays).


*Skills and Abilities*


* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. (High proficiency)
* Multi\-tasking skills and presentation skills. (High proficiency)
* Possess excellent organizational skills, with attention to detail and accuracy. (Medium proficiency)
* Strong time management skills.

title: Perigold Chief Marketing Officer
description:
Perigold, the luxury division of Wayfair, is seeking a Chief Marketing Officer to lead our ambitious marketing growth agenda, including an exciting expansion into physical retail. The CMO leads a team of 20\+ individuals and is responsible for a large media budget, omni\-channel brand and content strategy, partner advertising, promotions, and onsite marketing. The ideal candidate has deep experience and expertise in brand and performance marketing, thrives in an entrepreneurial and fast\-paced environment, and has demonstrated interest in luxury and/or design.



This role is based in Boston and works directly with the General Manager of Perigold as part of the brand’s leadership team.


**What you’ll do**


* Own and oversee the management of a \~$50M\+ advertising budget across all key platforms and channels, including, but not limited to, Google, Meta, Pinterest, various connected TV platforms and media agencies (eg Public Relations).
* Develop and execute an integrated, multi\-channel marketing strategy aligned with Perigold’s overall business goals and market\-specific nuances.
* Manage and optimize marketing initiatives across all key channels, including SEM, PLA, social, email marketing, SMS/Push notifications, display advertising, influencer/affiliate marketing, partnerships, online video, CTV/TV and more.
* Leverage market insights across both our B2C and B2B customer segments to identify and prioritize opportunities for growth, customer acquisition, retention, and brand positioning.
* Be the steward of the Perigold brand, working with the Perigold Creative team and the broader brand organization to ensure an elevated positioning and consistent brand presentation in line with the brand strategy.
* Analyze business performance and use data\-driven decision\-making processes to refine marketing strategies and optimize performance.
* Build, mentor, and lead a high\-performing marketing team, fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment.
* Partner with senior leaders and x\-functional teams to drive your agenda, including Pricing, Finance, Technology, Data Science, Design Services, Category Management, Physical Retail, Merchandising, Customer Service.
* Engage with external agencies, vendors, and other stakeholders to leverage external expertise and amplify marketing efforts.
* Develop and manage the marketing budget, ensuring efficient allocation of resources and maximum return on investment (ROI).
* Partner with Finance to develop the brand forecast; monitor marketing spend and adjust as needed to ensure financial targets are met.


**What You’ll Need**


* 10\+ years of marketing experience, with a strong background in brand and performance marketing, ideally including new store opening experience.
* Demonstrated success in a senior marketing leadership role, preferably within the retail or consumer goods sector. Luxury, design, or fashion industry experience a plus.
* Proven track record of driving growth, innovation, and brand excellence on a national scale.
* Advanced proficiency in data analytics, customer insights, and performance measurement tools.
* Exceptional strategic thinking and problem\-solving abilities.
* Strong understanding of digital marketing channels, platforms, and technologies.
* Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to thrive in a fast\-paced, dynamic, and results\-oriented environment.


**About Perigold**



Perigold is *the* destination for luxury home. Established in 2017, Perigold offers an unmatched selection of the world’s best design brands, with unique pieces for every style and space. We have the highest quality pieces for home. We also have free full\-service delivery and 30\-day returns on most items. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Perigold is part of the Wayfair Inc. (NYSE:W) brand portfolio. For more information on Perigold, please visit www.perigold.com and follow @perigold on Instagram, Facebook, and Pinterest.

title: Warehouse Extranet Management Team Associate (EMT) Days
description:
We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!

**Shift:** Mon\-Fri 7am\-3:30pm  

**Starting Pay:** $19\.50hr


Scope


We are looking for a responsible associate to maintain inventory accuracy of the Middle Mile product by performing cycle counts and quickly resolving any discrepancies found.


What you'll do:

* You'll use an RF scanner to perform a count of aged items daily
* You'll utilize the appropriate systems to report or correct order issues
* You will re\-route orders and re\-print shipping labels as needed
* Collaborate with other departments to investigate and resolve order issues quickly
* Escalate all discrepancies to management


What you'll need:

* 1 year previous Inventory/Cycle counting
* Knowledge of the safety and regulatory requirements and documentation (MSDS, OSHA, Equipment Checklist, BOL, etc.)
* You'll have worked with a WMS system
* Ability to work mostly unsupervised in a fast paced environment while achieving expected results
* Previously demonstrated ability to handle general administration tasks
* Experience with MS Office and have the ability to learn new systems quickly
* Strong MS Excel knowledge
* Physical strength to lift cartons up to 75 LBS consistently

title: Part-Time Sales Associate
description:
#### **Birch Lane Part Time Sales Assocaite**



Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring for our Birch Lane retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, this store might be the future home for your career.


**The pay for this position is $17\.05\-19\.90/hr however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience.**


**What you’ll do:**


* Provide an authentic, friendly customer experience that exemplifies our Wayfair commitment to relentless customer focus
* Drive sales in the store by asking great questions to understand customer needs, guiding them through their questions, providing product options (both within store and our endless aisle/online assortment via web and app) that leads to a satisfied customer experience.
* Demonstrate confidence in closing the sale and educating customers on various ways to purchase including through POS, Online, our App or through a Quote.
* Assist walk\-ins on the sales floor and in the design studio as needed.
* Be an expert in the services offered in store and online \- credit, financing, warranty, installation and delivery, always considering value adds to client purchases.
* Participate in all operational aspects of the store including but not limited to: processing new products, floor sets, replenishment, substitutions and general upkeep of the store
* Exemplify a positive and professional attitude on a daily basis with customers and your team members.
* Bring a willingness to share innovative ideas and solutions to continuously improve team operations.
* Engage in a high energy, focused and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions, offerings and operations.


**Criteria:**


* 1\+ years of retail sales experience (preferably in a design related environment). Interior design, specialty sales experience a plus
* Passion for great customer service and a drive to exceed sales targets.
* Strong organization, self\-motivation, communication and relationship management skills.
* Track record of thriving in a fast paced and changing environment, with an ability to adapt and grow
* Demonstrated ability to work within a team sales environment.
* Technical acumen to learn necessary software; proficiency in Google and Microsoft Office applications preferred.
* Ability to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends, and holidays

#### **Physical Requirements:**


* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel, lift overhead, and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.


**Compensation \& Benefits:**


* The pay for this position is $17\.05\-19\.90/hr however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
* Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount

title: Sr. Associate, Merchant
description:
**Senior Associate, Wayfair Curated Merchant\- Upholstery**



As a Curated Merchant, you will develop, execute and drive assortment strategies for your product category. Your ranges will become our “Wayfair Verified" (Wayfair’s super set of products that capture our highest % of revenue). You will influence how curated product ranges come to life across all Wayfair marketing channels (physical retail, print, digital and social), ensuring accurate product representation and appropriate shelf placement. You will foster strong cross functional relationships to ensure all strategies and goals are achieved, acting as the representative of the customer in strategic decisions on product placement. You will collaborate with Category Management, Marketing, Analytics \& Operations, and external Suppliers to ensure the strategic vision is executed all the way to the customer. Leveraging data\-driven qualitative and quantitative insights, you'll make a direct impact on overall sales, Wayfair share gains, and empower customers to create a home just right for them.


**What You’ll Do:**


* Build and maintain category assortment strategies, inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting, developing and iterating on the product offering
* Lead, coach \& develop a team of 1\-2 merchants (specific to upholstery) to deliver against your ambitious goals to transform our curation strategy
* Responsible for driving Wayfair Verified strategy in owned category including but not limited to: meeting audit goals, creating/optimizing product rubrics and establishing thresholds for quality cascades in like products
* Collaborate with leadership, Visual and P\&A to establish frameworks and targets for Wayfair physical retail assortment strategies, leveraging your team to help manage and maintain these assortments
* Own the financial outcomes for the performance of the products you placed on the premium shelf spaces. Regularly assess performance and revise assortment and shelf space allocation strategy as needed.
* Work closely with Category Management \+ SRB merchants to grow key Upholstery segments (ex: motion, custom, leather) where WF is currently under penetrated utilizing competitive analysis, trend research, and internal performance monitoring as data points.
* Domestic Travel \- \~bi\-weekly travel to off site audit studio \+ attending of 4 domestic tradeshows


**What You’ll Need:**


* \~4\+ years of experience within an e\-commerce or corporate retail organization preferred. Preferably experience in buying/retail merchandising or retail home furnishing planning.
* A strong interest in building a career in buying and/or supplier relationship management
* A passion or knowledge of industry trends, style and product design
* Ability to cut data and think critically about the business; ability to understand and interpret sales and performance trends and apply learning to the business
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal and the ability to influence cross\-functionally
* A personable and energetic communicator, eager to build relationships with new business partners \- both internally and externally
* Ability to communicate and feel comfortable speaking directly with C\-suite level suppliers from large companies
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects at once; you don’t miss the details and can work autonomously and with partners to drive projects and tasks to completion
* Ability to “hit the ground running” – a self\-starter capable of achieving specific target goals


**This is a hybrid position located in our Boston office. M\-Th in office, Friday's are remote.**

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. title: Wayfair Outlet Sales Associate (Part Time)
description:
**Wayfair Outlet Sales Associate**
==================================


Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring a Sales Associate for our returns Outlet retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, Wayfair’s Outlet store might be the future home for your career.
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

  


**Starting Rate: $18\.50 per hour** **Hours**: 20 hours per week
***Store hours:***

Monday \- Saturday: 10am \- 8pm

Sunday: 11AM\-7PM  

**Benefits to building a HOME for your career with Wayfair:**

* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)
* Wayfair company discount
* PTO
* Holiday pay
* 401(k) with company match
* Referral bonuses


**What you’ll do:**
* As an authentic brand ambassador for the Wayfair family, lead and create a best in class customer experience by connecting them with the world's biggest and best home online assortment brought to life in our stores.
* Greet customers as they walk in the store
* Assist at the cash wrap as needed
* Participate in operational aspects of the store, including receiving and replenishment
* Exemplify a positive and professional attitude
* Engage in a high energy, focused and dynamic work environment
* Support launch efforts with set\-up responsibilities such as unloading trucks, moving and unpacking boxes, building furniture, stocking shelves and cleaning
* Perform other duties as assigned by the shift supervisor
* Follow all company policies and Wayfair standards

  


**Criteria:**
* Customer service experience preferred, but open to entry\-level
* Passion for great customer service and a drive to exceed sales targets


* Strong organization, self\-motivation, communication and relationship management skills.


* Comfortable working in a fast paced and changing environment
* Technical acumen to learn necessary software
* Associates are expected to have availability to meet the needs of the business.
* All employees will be expected to represent the brand through polished communication, personal appearance and professionalism

  


**Essential Functions:**
* Excellent verbal communication skills
* Excellent active listening skills
* Excellent sales and customer service skills
* Ability to anticipate customers' needs
* Technical acumen to learn necessary software and systems
* Ability to process information and merchandise through a computer system and POS register system


**Physical Requirements:**
--------------------------



* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee **must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs**
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus

  


**Working Hours:**

At Wayfair and our family of brands, we strive to provide our employees with a work schedule that protects their work/life balance and takes their scheduling preferences into consideration. Please understand due to the nature of the retail industry, your shift schedule will vary. However, we will work to provide you with your schedule a minimum of 2 weeks in advance, and you will have the opportunity to trade with teammates as needed.

Our store hours are Monday \- Saturday: 10am \- 8pm \& Sunday 11am \- 7pm. Employee shifts may include two hours before or after store hours.

  

Employment/promotion to this role will be contingent on successful completion of a background check. **Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities**

As part of this commitment, Wayfair will make reasonable accommodations to the known physical or mental limitations of qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on business operations. title: Warehouse Associate
description:
***The pay for this position is $15\.00/hr***



We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!

 **Shift**


* Monday \- Friday 7:00am \- 3:30pm


**Benefits**


* $1\.50/hr shift differential for hours worked after 6:00pm
* Referral bonus
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k) with company match
* Wayfair company discount
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)
* Dozens of discounts and perks with partners


**What You'll Do**


* Unload and receive inbound furniture orders which will require manually moving large, heavy goods.
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 pounds unassisted and maneuvering product 150\+ pounds unassisted or via team lift.
* Use scan technology to document pertinent carton level information, including condition, quantity, and warehouse location of material.
* Proactively monitor order management systems to ensure that all orders have been received properly and that detailed descriptions are provided for any Overage/Shortage/Damage issues.
* Perform regular cycle counts to ensure inventory is accurate and up to date.
* Pick deliveries from inventory and stage them by truck and stop number.
* Provide direct input into the existing user tools and make recommendations for improvements based on your everyday experience.
* Be a vocal contributor on the team.
* Work effectively with peers and managers.
* Identify the most efficient way to complete assigned tasks and asks clarifying questions when appropriate.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.
* Be cross trained in other departments and required to perform additional responsibilities as assigned


**What You'll Need**


* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 lbs. unassisted and moving product 150\+ lbs. unassisted or via team lift.
* Must be able to work on warehouse floor 8 hours a day or more.
* Strong, consistent work ethic.
* Comfort with scanning technology.
* Experience in Distribution or Logistics is a plus.
* Experience working in High Jump is a plus.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.

**Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities**  

Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. title: Senior Benefits Associate
description:
*This position is a hybrid in\-office role that works out of our Boston HQ. Monday\-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.*



We are seeking a Senior Benefits Associate to support the administration, compliance, and cost management of our U.S. health, welfare and absence programs. This role will play a critical part in ensuring compliance with federal, state, and provincial regulations, analyzing key cost drivers, and implementing strategic interventions to optimize healthcare spend.



The ideal candidate is an analytical, detail\-oriented professional with a strong understanding of health plan design, regulatory compliance, and benefits analytics. This position offers an opportunity to take ownership of complex projects, collaborate with senior stakeholders, and drive cost\-effective, consumer driven benefits strategies.


**What You'll Do**


***Health Plan Administration \& Operations***


* Support the administration of U.S. health \& welfare plans, ensuring compliance, efficiency, and a seamless employee experience.
* Act as a subject matter expert for escalated benefits issues, partnering with vendors and internal teams to drive resolution.
* Lead annual benefits enrollment efforts, including communication strategies, vendor system testing, and employee education initiatives.
* Conduct in\-depth analyses of claims data, plan performance, and utilization trends to guide program enhancements.


***Health Plan Analytics \& Cost Containment***


* Analyze health plan cost drivers, including claims trends, high\-cost claimants, and utilization patterns.
* Develop and present data\-driven recommendations to optimize plan design, reduce unnecessary costs, and enhance employee engagement.
* Support negotiations with vendors and insurers to ensure cost\-effective benefits solutions.
* Stay informed on industry benchmarks, regulatory changes, and emerging trends to proactively manage risks and opportunities.


***Compliance \& Regulatory Oversight***


* Ensure ongoing compliance with ERISA, ACA, HIPAA, COBRA, and state\-specific regulations.
* Lead efforts on 5500 filings, PCORI, RxDC and other mandated reporting
* Partner with legal and external counsel to stay ahead of regulatory updates affecting U.S. benefits programs.


***Absence Program Management***


* Design and optimize absence programs to ensure legal compliance, alignment with company values and business needs
* Serve as the subject matter expert (SME) on leave of absence programs and related employment practices.
* Provide guidance to the leave administration team, ensuring consistent communication and a high\-quality experience.
* Maintain compliance with federal and state regulations including FMLA, ADA, HIPAA, and local leave laws


***Vendor \& Stakeholder Collaboration***


* Manage vendor relationships, ensuring adherence to contracted service levels, reporting accuracy, and cost containment goals.
* Support RFPs, plan renewals, and implementation of new benefits programs
* Collaborate cross\-functionally with Talent, Finance, Legal, and Procurement teams to align benefits programs with business needs.
* Provide strategic insights and recommendations to senior leadership on benefits trends and plan performance.


**What You'll Need**


* 3\+ years of experience in benefits administration, compliance, or benefits analytics.
* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources Management or related field preferred \- equivalent experience and proven results in HR Management, Benefits, FMLA, ADA will also be strongly considered.
* Strong knowledge of U.S. benefits regulations (ACA, ERISA, HIPAA, COBRA, etc.).
* Experience with health plan data analysis, claims reporting, and cost containment strategies.
* Strong problem\-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data and make strategic recommendations.
* Ability to work independently in a fast\-paced team environment while managing multiple priorities.
* Experience working with HRIS systems and benefits platforms (Workday / Alight preferred).
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. title: Part Time Furniture Repair Technician III
description:
***The pay for this position is $35\.83/hr***  

We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair! **Shift*** Part Time Monday \- Friday Day Shift

**Wayfair Benefits*** Weekly Pay (Fridays)
* Referral bonus
* Wayfair company discount
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)

 **What You'll Do*** Work independentlyto evaluate damages and defects of items and determine if items can be repaired. Make any required adjustments to items ahead of delivery and ensure item is in perfect condition to be delivered to the customer
* Prioritize and execute on daily, weekly, and monthly tasks (repairs) to ensure completion in a effective and timely manner
* Accurately reports outcomes of work in progress, completed, \& past due work
* Monitors inventory, and orders replacement parts and complete installs as needed
* Ask clarifying questions when appropriate
* Administer appropriate repair methods for various product types including, but not limited to:
* + Evaluate each piece of furniture to determine the type of wood and/or upholstery repairs, parts, and materials needed to complete the job
	+ Case Goods: Burn\-ins, refinishing, joinery, match colors, and simulate wood grain
	+ Refinishes and patches damaged furniture including paint, stain, enamel or lacquers; mixes paints and stains to match existing finish
	+ Repairs, replaces and rebuilds damaged wood, leather or upholstery furniture or mechanical parts
	+ Operates tools such as power drills, sanders, saws, and other tools required for repair
* Use scan technology to document pertinent carton level information, including condition, quantity, warehouse location and detail repair completed
* Provide direct input into the existing user tools and make recommendations for improvements based on expertise \& experience
* Be a vocal contributor on the team
* Contribute to the building and development of training materials for applicable functions
* Must understand that this role will require you to work cooperatively with others, adjust to change, be a reliable team member, and work with other towards a common goal

 **What You'll Need*** Advanced understanding of repairing wood items including: color and stain matching, damage/defect repair
* Ability to use power and hand tools as needed
* Advanced understanding of repairing upholstery and multiple fabric types a plus
* High attention to detail and prioritizes quality to deliver a perfect item to the customer.
* Must be comfortable lifting up to 75 lbs. unassisted and moving product 150\+ lbs. unassisted or via team lift
* Must be able to work on warehouse floor up to 8 hours a day or more
* Strong, consistent work ethic and ability to manage time effectively
* Comfort with scanning technology.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.
* Must be at least 18 years of age.
* Certification in Furniture Repair/Restoration, preferred

 **Safety**
The safety of employees remains our \#1 priority and is at the heart of every decision made. We have taken a variety of steps to ensure that Wayfair is one of the safest places to work by:* Providing Guidelines to help employees maintain proper social distancing
* Providing and requiring suitable PPE such as masks, gloves, and safety vests.
* Increased sanitizing stations, as well as, improved professional sanitization of each facility.

Team stretches at the start of each shift * \- if you've come to flex

title: Senior Consultant, Operations Analytics
description:
*Must be onsite in Boston, MA (Monday\-Thursday)*



We are looking for advanced analytical, action\-oriented, and collaborative individuals who can translate business problems into data\-driven solutions and actionable insights to influence operational results. Successful individuals in this role excel at both qualitative and quantitative analysis while also being eager to communicate upward and outward to tell a concise story.



You will join the Operations Analytics team focused on steering Wayfair’s long\-term strategic operations outlook. The Operations Analytics team supports long\-term, high\-scope, high\-complexity strategic planning and business case questions within the operations organization. We work closely across Operations Research, Network Management, Transportation \& Delivery and other operations teams to ensure continuity between their near and medium\-term planning objective functions with our future state strategic outlooks.


**What You’ll Do:**


* Work within a small but high\-impact team focused on providing analytical firepower to several groups under the operations umbrella, with a focus on Fulfillment, Planning, and Analytics.
* Support the strategic outlook and review pipeline for our global fulfillment and home delivery network, steering decisions to grow, reshape, and optimize our network footprint and within the 4 walls operations.
* Support work across teams ranging from Network Management, Operations Research, Transportation and Delivery, Real Estate, Customer Service, and more.
* Contribute to projects that span various operational domains, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.
* Run the end\-to\-end analytics to recommendation pipeline, designing and building models that glean data insights, packaging insights into concise and actionable recommendations, and selling the data story to our cross functional and senior stakeholders.
* Utilize your experience in SQL, python, and spreadsheet modelling to build tailored and robust sensitivity analyses that unlock core business insights. Develop tools and dashboards that provide critical insights, enabling data\-driven decision\-making.
* Work in a fast paced, highly iterative environment that is responsive to the evolving needs of our operations functions and strategies.


**What You’ll Need:**


* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Operations Research, or a related discipline with a strong academic record.
* Experience in an analytics or data science role, performing quantitative analysis and delivering actionable recommendations from findings.
* Ability to synthesize insights from undefined and open ended problem sets and articulate into clear, top down evidence backed narratives. Present complex information in a concise and understandable manner.
* Advanced proficiency in **SQL**, including knowledge of aggregate functions, joins, etc.
* Hands\-on experience and comfortability with **python** for data manipulation, analysis, and modeling.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills, with experience building comprehensive slide decks and white papers.
* Solution\-oriented \& curious intellectual mindset and curiosity, with a passion for continuous learning and problem\-solving.
* High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously, ensuring timely and accurate deliverables.
* Strategic thinker, able to provide direction and support to the team in setting clear project goals, managing the execution of projects that align with business objectives.
* Experience with or knowledge of supply chain and logistics concepts is a strong plus.


**An Important Note about Wayfair's In\-Office Policy:** All Boston\-based interns, Co\-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday \- Thursday, and work remotely Friday.


**Massachusetts Applicants:** I understand that it is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.
